Description:
I'm raising money for Bromley Homeless. Here's Larry's story which any one of us might identify with, particularly after the past 18 months in the pandemic. Any sum you can spare will be spent on supporting someone in need or directly bringing comfort or relief to their time of hardship. Thank you.

"I lost everything in the pandemic including my job, my home and my connection with my kids. It wasn't possible to sleep on the buses or pop into a church for a cup of tea. I was reduced to sleeping in woodlands and abandoned lock-ups for six months, until I found [Bromley Homeless]. I will never forget everything you have done for me. Thank you." - LarryB, aged 51
Title: Fundraising for Bromley Homeless this Winter

Title: Homeless's Homeless nation

Description:
Give while quizzing! 

Wycombe Homeless Connection helps people across south Buckinghamshire who are homeless. This winter, they are providing
emergency accommodation and personal support for people who otherwise would be sleeping on the street. They believe everyone has worth, has the right to a home and will do everything they can to bring homelessness to an end.
Title: WHC Big Quiz 2021

Description:
Winter 2021-22 is going to be extra tough.

Wycombe Homeless Connection needs our help to make sure there will be help and hope this winter for anyone who needs it.

Locally, efforts to keep everyone in have just ended and more people will need a safe place to stay this winter.

The huge challenge they face is keeping everyone who doesnt have a home off the street, in suitable accommodation, with everything they need to stay healthy and well, while helping them find a more suitable, more permanent home. All this while there continues to be a severe shortage of suitable and affordable homes meaning moving on from emergency accommodation can be incredibly difficult.

The good news is because of your support, WHC can be here to help.
Title: Wycombe Homeless Connection's Big Sleepout 2021: At Home

Description:
Homelessness is a heartbreaking plague on our society, a walk around any British city will show you this. As lucky people with access to shelter, water, warmth and food, it’s our job to shine a light on this unfairness and do what we can to help those with nowhere to go. 


Thirsk Homeless Organisation has been doing great work distributing sought after items to charities trying to tackle homelessness in and around York city centre. In a bid to raise more awareness of this nationwide emergency, a small group of us are taking to the streets of York to spend a night in the shoes of those with no home. Luckily for us, this is a one night drive in the hope of raising some money. But this is reality for an ever growing, forgotten, population. It’s not right. If you can, please help us to support Crisis, who offer help to those who need it most, in the darkest possible times. They do unbelievable work but they can’t do it alone. A few quid can really really help.


We can only imagine how devastating and dehumanising it is to be without support, without a home...combine this desperation with the approach of the Christmas festivities, a time meant for celebration and families and joy. Crisis at Christmas can provide somebody in need with 3 daily hot meals, a shower, a bed for the night, physical and mental health advice, and more for just £28.18! 


Some of the money raised will also be sent to Hoping - York Street Kitchen to help them feed the forgotten population on this city over the festive period and beyond. Angels. 


If you can’t donate right now but want to show your support by joining us, then get in touch. The more the merrier. Solidarity. 


Thank you for reading this.


Ellie, Beth, Lisa, Kelly, Emma, Anna, Gemma, Kyra xoxoxox
Title: Thirsk Homeless Organisation Sleepout (York)

Description:
Christmas is a time for being around family, friends and loved ones. But for many homeless people, it is one of the loneliest and most difficult times of the year.

This Christmas, you can help make a difference to homeless and vulnerable people across London by supporting My Christmas Wish. 

How will your gift help?

  • £15 can pay for a train ticket for one of our clients to visit their family.
  • £50 can provide a client with a Christmas hamper full of essential
  • £100 can help us to cook Christmas dinner for our hostel residents.
  • £250 can fund a social session for our clients so they won’t be alone this Christmas.

Bee's Story:

After a particularly violent episode, Bee left her abusive partner and moved into a friend's flat. She spent her first Christmas by herself, an experience she describes as ‘terrible’.

Believing herself to be utterly alone, Bee tried to take her own life. With support from SHP, Bee has now made a full recovery, rediscovering her passion for music.
Title: My Christmas Wish

Description:
We here at Homeless Ghost Prints specialise in sport illustration prints. Legend footballer John Barnes appears on our England, Liverpool and Watford prints. John has kindly signed a copy of each team print which we are giving you the chance to win. 

We want to raise as much money as we can to help the COVID-19 appeal for the Wirral University Teaching Hospital NHS Foundation Trust. All funds raised will go to help enhance the well-being of the NHS staff, volunteers, patients, and, Arrowe Park Hospital and Clatterbridge Hospital which have been impacted. 

There is a minimum donation of £5 for a chance to win one of the signed prints. Please state in the comments section of your donation which team print you want to win and also ensure that you include your full name. 

HGP and John want to raise as much money as we can to help support these hospitals and their incredible staff. 

Last entry for the competition will be Friday 29th May.
Title: HGP x John Barnes fundraiser to help COVID-19 appeal at WUTH

Description:

Description:

Want a challenge to get fit during lockdown whilst  raising awareness and funds for an amazing charity? Then this is for you! Helping Our Homeless Wales want you to record a run, jog or walk. Description:
Thank you for taking the time to visit my JustGiving page.

I love to help raise funds for a good cause, and I am raising the funds for the UCKG Helpcentre so that they can continue their great work.

The UCKG Helpcentre has been able to reach thousands of people through their 24hour Helpline, Soup Kitchen, Food Bank, Give warmth (gifting children in hospital & children in prison inmates) and Night angels(hitting the streets light to provide food packages for those sleeping rough). 

They also have VYG (youth organisation to help youths make a positive choices for their future), senior citizens care for the elderly, patience care group and much more and have a tremendous impact on those needed help at their lowest point.

Just to see some of the work done by the UCKG Helpcentre, please click on the link below.

Title: Grace - UCKG Helpcentre

Description: The Whitechapel Centre work hard to make sure no one needs to sleep rough in Liverpool, but there are still people who need our help. For any one rough sleeping we provide help 24 hours a day, 365 days a year and we dont turn anyone away there is always room inside during the night and day to access our services.
Title: Uol Help the Homeless's page

Description:
On Friday 3rd December, I'm going to be homeless for a night by "sleeping rough".

This will be my 23rd year of enduring the freezing temperatures to sleep on the cold, wet, dirty, noisy streets where, if I'm lucky, I'll find a patch of tarmac that's a bit 'softer' than the concrete. I'll have insects, rats and whatever else lurks at night in a city centre to keep me company. 

If the terrible weather wasn't enough, I'll be making it even more difficult by not using any umbrellas, sleeping bags, tents, groundsheets or anything other than the clothes on my back and whatever shelter I can construct using a few scraps of cardboard and a plastic bag.

Why? To raise money for St. Basils, a UK registered homelessness prevention charity who work with vulnerable young people regardless of their background, religion or ethnicity who are homeless or face the terrifying possibility of homelessness. They support them with accommodation, support services, mentoring and skills development to them back on their feet so they can eventually become self-sustaining. Please support them and help make sure they never end up on the streets.

There are no fundraiser, minimum sponsorship or admin costs and every penny you donate will go directly St Basils - plus full Gift Aid. Please sponsor me with whatever amount you can - every penny counts!

Thank you!

Zain
Title: Help! Zain's Homeless!

Description: The Royston Rough Sleepers team has been sleeping out on December nights for CUF’s work with the homeless since 2017. Numbers fluctuate; this year there may be ten of us. It’s quite a harsh thing to do, always cold, sometimes wet, once a bitter frost and a full moon, and though we have tarpaulins and sleeping bags and mats, and dinner inside us and breakfast to look forward to, still it gives some idea of what it must be to face this night after night. So it’s marvellous that so many people are joining in. If you can, do please support us.

In these testing times, we are determined to do more. Support us
Title: Cyrena's Christmas charity and homeless support

Description:
New Horizons are a vital support group network for 16-24 year-olds with nowhere else to go. There are many reasons why thousands of young people across the capital find themselves homeless or needing help, whether due to family breakdown, domestic abuse, poverty, experiences of violence, or war and persecution in their home country. For as long as young people are homeless and undeserved in London, New Horizons will be on a mission to give them their potential home. 

Visit www.nhyouthcentre.org.uk for more information.
Title: New Horizon's Youth Centre

Description:
At this difficult time, we all need some extra help to lift our spirits and have some fun. We are asking our CAREGivers, our Clients, local businesses and friends to take part in a Virtual Dance-Along to 'Let's Twist Again'. This will take place on Friday the 13th November from 9.30am-6pm.

We can do this while also making a difference! Children in Need support local projects, helping remove the barriers that are facing children and young people so they can thrive. Even the smallest contribution can have a big impact! 

Please click on the link to listen to our chosen song:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=VjQwfkQj6e4

The plan is throughout the day for as many people to be involved in carrying out the ‘twist’. You can also ask your family and friends to sponsor you.

Some people may find it difficult to carry out a dance to this song, but this can be done with them sitting down. This will be done via Zoom and you can use your phone to participate with us (we will be playing the music to you from our office). You can join at any time! There may be a short wait time before you are admitted into the session so please bear with us.

If you do know of anyone else who would want to be involved, please let us know! We hope to lift everyones spirits whilst making a difference!

Click the following zoom link to join below (we will be running from 9:30am – 6pm):

https://zoom.us/j/98020785963?pwd=NCtxcnY3OUlyRElOQUlTL2hiNTRUdz09

Title: Home Instead's The Friday Request Show

Description:
As part of participating in this great project, volunteers are encouraged to set up fundraisers to support the amazing work that Crisis does. 

Things have changed since the start of the pandemic, but Crisis has done an amazing job adapting to the situation, while still providing a great service as they do every year. 

Crisis at Christmas is a campaign that helps to provide warm meals, shelter, support and companionship at Christmas to those experiencing homelessness. More than that, the impact of Crisis at Christmas lasts long after Christmas, as guests are introduced to Crisis’ year-round training, education and support to leave homelessness behind for good! 

Any donation, however big or small, would be greatly appreciated ☺️
Title: Donate to help the homeless this Christmas!

Description:
Welcome - Thanks for taking the time to visit this Just Giving page.

Specifically your funding will go towards purchasing the below items for the homeless this Christmas in 2021:

  • Hats/socks/gloves/scarves
  • Leggings
  • Deodorants/face wipes/shower gels
  • Ladies sanitary products
  • Men’s boxers
  • Women’s underwear
  • Unisex T-shirts S/M/L
  • Tracksuit bottoms unisex S/M/L
  • Hoodies S/M/L
  • Trainers (7-10) men and ladies (4-7)
  • Sweaters, coats and thermal clothing
  • Small note pads and pens
  • Coffee shop gift cards around £5.00 or £10.00
  • Shampoos/deodorants/shaving foam or gels
  • Toothbrushes/toothpaste/hairbrushes

How did this campaign start ?

In Autumn of 2017 I was Finance Manager for locality of Reading for Berkshire Health Care NHS Foundation Trust.

In my monthly meeting I was asked for extra funding by the Health Outreach Liaison Team (HOLT). HOLT provide clinics and go out nightly to individuals who are living on the streets to check on their physical and mental health needs. Many of these people are ageing. In addition to the issues resulting from their lifestyle have all the usual age related health problems made worse by their lives and exposure on the streets.

I knew there was no extra funding available.  Walking back to my car after the meeting I was really troubled, disheartened and felt a strong sense of failure, I said to myself I have to do something to help support obtain extra funding for this cause.

I decided to run a shoe box appeal which I originally started in 2017 for The HOLT to collect items for homeless.  I got fantastic support from colleagues and their families to support our local NHS team to bring a little cheer to homeless people in our area at Christmas.

I started this appeal by creating a poster and then donations very quickly started to arrive!  People from within the Berkshire NHS Healthcare Foundation Trust would bring me all the items which were listed on the poster and often new items purchased from the shops.  These items were all sorted,  picked and we created many shoes boxes for the Homeless. During our lunch time my colleagues would take in turn to help me to pick items to make up each shoes box.  We set up a production line where some would cut wrapping paper, apply cello-tape and check shoes boxes which were made gender specific. At Christmas 2017 a total of 148 shoes boxes were made and distributed in Berkshire.

As this campaign was so successful I have been running campaigns every year.  This will be my 5th year to run this appeal for Homeless. Since the pandemic in 2020, I believe it is ever more important to support the homeless as the number of people that requires support has increased. For 2020 appeal the total donations were raised for the sum of £1,836.25 including gift aid.  Also the staff and families of Berkshire Healthcare NHS FT donated:

30 Bags (sacks) of second clothes

5 Bags (sacks) of new items including underwear and toiletries.

Your donations would be going to an extremely worthy cause as The HOLT staff are engaging very closely, at a personal level, with people in Berkshire who are homeless. They develop caring relationships with the individuals and build up rapport, human contact and communicate with humour to help support their mental well-being in what are often difficult care conditions. This team sees the damage that isolation brings, especially at times of year which are particularly family centred celebrations.

I would kindly ask to please give no matter how small the amount as your donations will make all the difference to the homeless this Christmas.

Warm Regards – Anita Patel
Title: Anita's Christmas Campaign For The Homeless: Reading & Newbury 2021

Description:
Thanks for taking the time to visit our JustGiving page.

Your donation will go directly to Sussex Homeless Support (SHS), a volunteer run charity, to support people facing homelessness this Christmas. This year SHS want to provide everyone that is homeless and rough sleeping with a parcel full of essentials as well as treats. No one should be homeless at Christmas or any other time but a parcel reminding them people care just might make the difference.

Title: Christmas Fundraising for Sussex Homeless Support

Description:
Ok gang - as has become tradition, the winter fundraiser will be for a UK based homeless charity. Now, perhaps more than ever before, we need to pull together and lift others up in any way that we can. For less than the cost of a take out coffee you can be a part of something lovely.

How does it work?

Mostly it works because you are all kind to be honest but...essentially I'm just making it easy for you to donate a little and make a difference. If you'd like to join the chatter and maybe get sent a little 'thank you' if you're picked at random then you can hop on over to my FB page (of half imagined things) and add your name to the pinned post - I will be picking a few names at random and gifting small pieces of art as a thank you. Feel free to come and say hello

I'm asking for a £2 minimum donation but if you can dig deep, please do - I know its been a hard year for as all though and ay contribution is hugely appreciated. Please - NO GIFT AID - this is because a few folk will be sent treasures which makes us exempt in this case.

Thank you - Jen @ ofhalfimaginedthings xxx

The number of people who found themselves sleeping on our streets increased each year from 2010 to 2018, with only a slight drop off in the last two years. StreetLink exists to help connect people sleeping rough to local support services by enabling members of the public to send an alert when they see someone sleeping out.Since we launched, over 200,000 alerts have been sent about people sleeping rough and thousands of people have been offered the support they need to escape rough sleeping.
Title: Of half imagined things - annual homeless appeal

Description:
Thanks for taking the time to visit my JustGiving page.

My 11 year old daughter (Sophie) was very distressed as the temperature started to drop to realise that more and more people are being made homeless.

We came up with the idea of spending 12 hours (6pm Friday 26th Nov to 6am Sat 27th Nov) on the pavement outside of our house to try and raise awareness and money for a local charity helping with this - Porchlight Kent, but also for us to have a 1st hand experience of what people are going through day after day.

Anything you can give can make a difference to someone in this terrible situation. Thank you.
Title: Sophie's Sleep Out for Homeless Nov 2021

Description: The Whitechapel Centre work hard to make sure no one needs to sleep rough in Liverpool, but there are still people who need our help. For any one rough sleeping we provide help 24 hours a day, 365 days a year and we dont turn anyone away there is always room inside during the night and day to access our services.
Title: Help the Homeless Society 's page

Description:
Thanks for taking the time to visit my JustGiving page.

St Basils works with young people aged 16-25 who are homeless or at risk of homelessness, to enable them to find and keep a home, grow their confidence, develop their skills, increase opportunities and prevent homelessness.

I want to do my part and give back to the people in Birmingham. My aim is to make a small difference for the people struggling and if i can do that I'll be very happy! Please donate anything you can, it wont go unnoticed. Thank you in. advance 

Joe
Title: Joe's Big Sleep-out for the Homeless

Description: Drug and alcohol addiction is a disease that destroys the lives of many. A common side affect of addiction is homelessness. A study has found that 1 in 25 people in the UK are dependant on alcohol irrespective of income, education or race. At WBS we are supporting Changes UK to facilitate a conversation among business leaders about addiction and the workplace and to raise money for CEOSleepout. No-one should be sleeping alone on the streets in freezing conditions. We are taking part in CEO Sleepout to help Changes UK in their mission to change pain through purpose, to raise awareness about addiction and to deliver peer-led recovery services to those who need it most. PS: At least two of our sleepout team are (very) nervous about the bracing cold of a December night on the streets of Birmingham.
Title: Sleeping out to raise awareness of addiction and homelessness

Description:
Veterinary care is one of the biggest ongoing costs for our BDH. In 2020 they spent over £230,000 on life-saving and life-changing treatments and this cost is rising every year. They accept every dog that needs their help, no matter their condition. Many of the dogs brought in are strays which means that they are often malnourished or have suffered some form of neglect or abuse, including multiple injuries or untreated medical conditions. Sometimes dogs are handed over by owners because the cost of their medical treatment is too much for them.The vet clinic will significantly reduce their vet bills and enable them to better manage both emergency cases and the ongoing physical health of the dogs they receive on a daily basis. 


Donations of any size will make a BIG difference to the homeless dogs in their care. Here are some examples...£


£8 can pay for antibiotic ointment, gauze wipes and towels

 44 can pay for an IV fluid stand

£97 can pay for a stretcher trolleys
Title: Healing Hearts Appeal - Helping Homeless Dogs

Description: I've been watching football at Plough Lane ever since I was a young journalist on the Wimbledon News. My first sports job in 1958 was to report a Dons game. Hundreds more followed over the decades but I've never slept there. That changes this Saturday when I and a group of supporters and players will be bedding down for the night at the ground in aid of the Dons Local Action Group, a volunteer force which supports local charities including three for the homeless. I'm fortunate to have a choice where to sleep but many others don't and they suffer alone in the freezing outdoors. So please help me help them have a better winter and a better Christmas.
Title: I'm sleeping out for the homeless in aid of DLAG

Description: Serving the people of Birkenhead and the Wirral since 1892, the Mission looks to help men and women who are homeless, poor and needy, out of poverty. We provide hot food, clothing, toiletries, other basic essentials, along with much love, care and compassion. For many, the Mission is a place to come for friendship, food, support and advice. It’s a safe place that offers help. Without your support, we wouldn’t be able to play our part in this community.
Title: Joanne's Sleeping out with the homeless page

Description:
Winter 2021-22 is going to be extra tough.

Wycombe Homeless Connection needs our help to make sure there will be help and hope this winter for anyone who needs it.

Locally, efforts to keep everyone in have just ended and more people will need a safe place to stay this winter.

The huge challenge they face is keeping everyone who doesnt have a home off the street, in suitable accommodation, with everything they need to stay healthy and well, while helping them find a more suitable, more permanent home. All this while there continues to be a severe shortage of suitable and affordable homes meaning moving on from emergency accommodation can be incredibly difficult.

The good news is because of your support, WHC can be here to help.

Title: HELP HOPE CENTRE

Description: Many children are born blind, deaf or mute, but their story can be bigger and brighter than that. It doesn't have to be all doom and gloom! They can sing, dream big, play drums and show lots of heart. Deserving children desperately want to stand on their own two feet and we want to help out other blind, deaf, and homeless young people. Here at EastHands we want to assist in the educational needs of those most in need in Bangladesh and just £300 a year can help to dramatically improve a young persons education. These children don't have to be helpless and hopeless in a country which stigmatizes the less able. They have always been invisible in Bangladesh. Lets not treat these people like second-class citizens and often they are mistakenly identified as emotionally or intellectually challenged. In some parts of Bangladesh, it breaks my heart to reveal they are even branded as a curse. Living in some of the most disadvantaged communities in rural and urban settings, their ticket out of
Title: Improve the life of a poor, blind, deaf or homeless child

Description:
Barnabus provide help and support to those living rough on the streets of Manchester.

Autumn and winter can be a particularly life threatening and challenging time of year for anyone sleeping rough in our City and it is a very busy time for the charity as they try and keep people fed, warm, dry and as safe as possible.

How can you help?

We have received a donation of 35 hand knitted woollen hats; these have been lovingly made and donated by a staff members mum for the charity. 

By buying one of these hats for a donation of £5 you will

  • supply someone living on the streets with a warm hat for the winter
  • pay for someone living on the streets to be able to visit Barnabus Beacon Support Centre, where they will have access to food, fresh clothes, shower facilities and healthcare services.

Thank you in advance for your support, every donation really does make a difference

CSR Team, Manchester

Title: Ibrox Sleep Out for Homeless Awareness

Description:
Homeless at Christmas 🎄 

During December the festive season moves into full swing as we prepare for the Christmas holidays.

Many people won’t be spending the holidays in comfort and safety. Last year, a report from Shelter found that in England alone, 280,000 people were sleeping rough or staying in temporary housing and hostels on Christmas Day.

On Monday the 6th December I will be sleeping out at St Andrews, the home of Birmingham FC. Whilst this is just one night in the cold, the aim is to raise funds and awareness to support an important issue in our society.

Your donation will go to the CEO Sleepout Charity which funds local charities at the frontline of homelessness and their national work with UK business leaders to reduce inequalities in society.

I really appreciate your support, your donation will go a long way.

Title: Homeless At Christmas

Description:
Please support Gill and I by donating to our "40 Winks" sleep out for homelessness! 

This year we would like to see in my special birthday in support of those who find themselves facing this winter alone, cold, hungry and in fear.  Homelessness is at an all time high and we'll be putting ourselves in their shoes for one night, braving whatever East Linton's elements may want to throw at us on the evening of December 3rd as we sleep out for Homeless Project Scotland. 

Other than "are you both crazy", we've also been asked: "how can you stay safe?", "how will you survive sub zero temperatures?", "how will you stay dry if it's wet and stormy?", "how will you keep warm?", and "what if something should happen to you?" These are all very good questions and we cannot imagine having to ask ourselves these every day, uncertain of the answers with nowhere to turn to.

Please help us to raise funds in support of those who have no warmth, no home and nowhere to feel safe. Together, let's give them some festive hope, hope for the future.

Homeless Project Scotland is a non-profit organisation set up in 2019 to help and support the homeless and vulnerable across Scotland.

Title: Sienna's Homeless helping

Description:
In response to Simon Dudley and the Windsor Council's request for the streets of Windsor to be cleansed of the homeless prior to the royal wedding it would be great to have a demonstration of public support for the homeless and a demonstration of disgust with Simon Dudley whilst he sits in his American ski chalet and treats the disadvantaged and homeless with contempt.

His request to Thames Valley Police to cleanse the streets is a complete dereliction of his statutory responsibilities to provide accommodation for the homeless whilst attempting to abdicate responsibility to an already overworked police service for a problem they should be attempting to resolve. Policing is about protecting the vulnerable not sweeping them up like unwanted litter.

The homeless in Windsor and beyond sleep rough for a variety of reasons, many have found themselves in their position through a crisis in their lives for which they have had little or no choice. What they need is understanding, compassion and support. This government chose to prop up the banking system and pay for it through the slashing of the public sector and welfare support, this is the consequence. The world will be watching Windsor in May, let them see the true nature of Britain not a sanitised version cleansed for international viewing. Every penny raised on this page will go direct to the Salvation Army who are the leading charity in the UK committed to the support of the homeless and people in crisis. The Salvation Army is a registered charity and church working in 120 countries worldwide and is one of the largest and most diverse providers of social welfare in the world. In the UK and Republic of Ireland this work includes more than 800 Salvation Army social service centres and community churches. We provide unconditional friendship, support and very practical help to people in crisis and need and work with children, older people, homeless people and those dealing with drug and/or alcohol addiction.

Description:
Each day across all 32 London boroughs, our staff work with individuals to tackle the underlying causes of homelessness, such as poor mental health or drug and alcohol dependency.

Often that means being there for people at a critical time  whether to prevent their eviction or help them off the street; to get them into drug or alcohol treatment or support them with their mental health; or to help them find a job and a flat so that the so that they can take the final steps to living on their own.

Title: Fundraise for the homeless

Description:
Thank you for taking the time to visit my page and read my story.

For all three of my years studying in Cardiff, the number of homeless people sleeping rough on the freezing streets has always upset me. So I decided to try and do my bit. 

It's a simple idea, the total of all food and non-alcoholic beverages that enter my mouth each day has to be less than a pound. I'm allowing myself beers because I just can't afford to get any more boring after exam season has finished. 

I'm challenging myself to do this for the 30 days of June, I started on the 1st and all is going well! I'm allowing myself to eat at 2 parties so not to be rude to the host, but that's it! 

Though raising money for Huggard, a homeless shelter in Cardiff, the money should directly help the homeless population of Cardiff. I am also wanting to raise awareness for Hope for the Homeless, a fantastic charity society created and run by Cardiff University students. They are already doing great things to help Cardiff's homeless, but they're only just getting started so they need you to get behind them and support them in continuing to make a difference. So go check out their Facebook page and be sure to follow them to keep up to date with everything they get up to: https://www.facebook.com/groups/1647908288595404/

I fully understand living like this is not a game, nor a choice, for a lot of the world population. Approximately half of the world population living on less than £2 per day which grips around 700 million people worldwide in a vicious cycle of hunger and malnutrition.

Being hungry means more than just missing a meal. It’s a debilitating crisis and a perilous cycle that passes from one generation to the next: Families who struggle with chronic hunger and malnutrition consistently go without the nutrients their minds and bodies need, which then prevents them from being able to work, go to school, or improve their lives, anchoring them to a life of inescapable poverty.

So please donate to help a local cause that I hope will benefit some of the toughest lives in Cardiff. If you can't spare even a few pence, please get behind Hope for the Homeless by getting on their Facebook, following them and sharing them to all you friends.
Title: The One Pound Challenge

Description:
We are a group of four international students who want to raise funds for Whitechapel Centre, a centre that makes an amazing job of helping the homeless.

Everyday Whitechapel Centre receives about 30 to 40 rough sleepers, providing them with food, showers and laundry facilities; imagine that the cost of opening the centre for one day is about £548!!!!!

 So，we just want to help them with their growing workload，because as winter approaches，low temperatures will force much more homeless people to ask the centre for help. However, we also firmly believe that LOVE can keep out the cold wind and every human life is worth the same.

Title: Buzz Buzz!

Description:
Thanks for taking the time to visit my JustGiving page.

The growing rate of homelessness in Glasgow is ridiculous, often these people
Do not choose this life , some are ex soldiers , use to a strict regime, the minute they are out they cannot deal with the grown stigma of society and fitting into a white collar job . Some aren’t even born over here come over here for a better life with promising potential for life they have dreamed of . Yet are forced to live on the streets. Some have chosen this path in life addicted to drugs , drink etc. Others have been in and out of care at a young age and have never had real stability and the streets is all that they know . Everyday whilst we all live in this wee bubble of ours of our luxury lifestyle .Most people walk past these unfortunate people as if they are not there , quite often or not these people for the most of it aren’t after for your money they want acknowledgement they are humans beings like you and I . People are people like you and I regardless of there path in life we all have the same qualities of any other humans thoughts , feelings.

There is a lot that happens around the world we cannot control. We cannot stop earthquakes, we cannot prevent droughts, and we cannot prevent all conflict, but when we know where the hungry, the homeless and the sick exist, then we can help.

This Christmas I am raising money for shelter to buy the homeless basic essentials to get them through the winter .

So please patch your morning Starbucks for one morning and put it to a good cause make a difference because our life is luxury compared to anyone on the street . 👌🏻💪🏻
Title: Glasgow homelessness

Description:
Thank you f﻿or taking the time to visit the councillor's carol for the homeless. This is our personal contribution and effort in supporting the Oxford homeless.

The aim of the project is to raise money to support homeless provision at Oxford’s O’Hanlon House and Oxford Pathways. 

O’Hanlon House provides an assessment centre and resettlement floor for around 66 homeless people aged 18+. ... O’Hanlon House also takes the lead for Pathway Coordination for homeless services across Oxfordshire. £24.50 per week covers the costs for hot meals and services such as shower and laundry. The aim of the project is to raise funds to support the homeless during this difficult period.

Early next year in 2018, we will hold a photo-shoot for all our Homeless supporters outside the town hall. All donators will also be invited to sing with the councillors at next year’s 2018 carol service, and receive a personalised  'Homeless Hero' event memento.

Thank you for your support

Title: Cienna's Helping the homeless

Description:
Crawley Open House is a local independent charity who have served the homeless and vulnerable for 26 years. Today we run a 24 bed high-support hostel, 4 move-on houses with 20 residents, a drop-in day centre, a crisis food parcels service and a community outreach team. No-one locally does more on the front-line to look after those who find themselves homeless or disadvantaged. We can only do what we do because of the support of the generous community around us, which is why we need your help this May.

Crawley Open House has been on the front line serving the homeless and vulnerable of Crawley and West Sussex for 26 years. They operate a 24 bed high support hostel, a busy drop-in day centre open 365 days a year, 4 move-on houses and a community outreach team. They cover a huge swathe of West and Mid Sussex – there is no Horsham Open House, Haywards Heath Open House or East Grinstead Open House….

Last year they managed to resettle around 60% of hostel residents to
somewhere more appropriate and permanent. There were over 24,000 support appointments for residents, day centre users and those staying on the streets. No-one locally does more to stand alongside those who have fallen or are falling through the cracks in society, for whatever reason.

Crawley Open House are a medium-sized independent charity and rely heavily on the generosity of local Trusts, places of worship, schools, individuals and companies. They receive some statutory funding but are working hard to diversify their income streams so as not to be too dependent on it, in an uncertain political and economic climate.

They are about to start a building project to create a new day centre built around a life-skills and employability workshop for the homeless and vulnerable. They have raised around three quarters of the money required, and are busy fundraising for the rest.

They have remained open throughout the Coronavirus crisis, with a full hostel, 4 full move-on houses and almost 100 people temporarily accommodated locally by Mid Sussex, Horsham and Crawley Councils. Whilst costs and workload have increased it has been harder to raise funds and accept donations as a result of the pandemic, a lack of community events and the damaged local economy. Any donations towards their vital work through the ‘Hundred For The Homeless’ campaign will therefore be massively
appreciated.

My plan is to cycle 100 miles AND walk 100 miles in May to help raise some money for Crawley Open House.

Description: The Salvation Army is a registered charity and church working in 130 countries worldwide and is one of the largest and most diverse providers of social welfare in the world. In the UK and Republic of Ireland this work includes more than 800 Salvation Army social service centres and community churches. We provide unconditional friendship, support and very practical help to people in crisis and need and work with children, older people, homeless people and those dealing with drug and/or alcohol addiction. Alongside our work in the UK, The Salvati
Title: Alex's Busking for the Homeless

Description:
As the cold draws in and more people find themselves without shelter from the bitter Winter air, we have launched our next Craft for Care project.

This time, we are putting our crochet, knitting and odds bits of wool to good use and creating some warmth for the homeless. No one should have to face living on the streets at this time of year, but sadly they do, and we want to help in any way we can. As Crafters, the best way we know how is to use our needles, hooks and hands to Craft for Care.

As part of our mission, we have partnered with Shelter.
They help millions of people every year struggling with homelessness. Putting our needles together, hopefully, we can help raise awareness and bring a little bit of warmth across the UK’s cold winter.

All donations will go direct to Shelter. Plus, for every donation of £5 or more, we will make a hat. Once the donation has been made, we will get creating and send the goods to a local homeless charity, so they can distribute the hats to those that need them. We will include a little note saying “donated by ….”. Just make sure you label your donation so we know who it is from!

Title: Mark's Homeless Not helpless

Description:
Did you know that we send approximately 1Billion Christmas cards each year just in the UK with probably about 50% of those not being immediately recyclable.

Therefore, to not only help our environment I want to try and support some of the 110,000 young people in the UK who are experiencing homelessness right now through Violence, abuse, neglect and problems with mental health. This year has brought so much sadness on many fronts so if I can help those less fortunate then many of us, then I want to do my bit.

My wife and I haven't sent Christmas cards to our friends for the past few years and instead have donated to many charities whilst in London (at the stations etc) however, this year hasn't allowed us to do that so for 2020 I would like to donate £1 for each one of those it's suggested I would send ....obviously I don't have many friends ;0) 

About the Charity:
End Youth Homelessness is a UK-wide movement of local charities that have joined forces to tackle youth homelessness together. It provides a national platform to raise awareness, share experience and generate voluntary income.

The funds we raise help our members to increase capacity, services and sustainability in extremely challenging times. Our member charities house and support over 30,000 young people facing homelessness.

https://www.eyh.org.uk/en/about/

Title: Justine's Helping the Homeless

Description:
Thousands of people across the country are homeless and sleep rough on the streets. STC is looking to work closely with the homeless in our locality and we have set up a monthly stand in the City Centre aimed at assisting the homeless. 

Additionally, as the winter festive is approaches, this can often become a very lonely time for rough sleepers who have no friends or family to turn to. Our previous event at Bradford City Park on 21 December 2019 was a huge success when we held a festive congregation specifically for the homeless. 

We had a hot delectable meal and created that all inclusive atmosphere. Services at the event also extended to providing winter gift kits (including accessory clothes, dental kits, hygiene items) to combat their struggles and a basic health check by on-board qualified medical practitioners.
Title: ViaanSurr's page

Description:
Normally, we have a Christmas budget and go out to clients and suppliers and spread the Christmas joy. We decided to use it differently and support this cause, which is close to our hearts.

We believe the people helping to end the homelessness crisis are true heroes. We want to encourage others to support them as much as they can.

It is also important to us to encourage others to treat the homeless people as people too. We went out to speak to individuals on the streets, to find out what they need in the short-term but also to provide them with a chance to engage in conversation.

Please donate to those who are helping provide a home for everyone, because everybody deserves one.
Title: Help the Homeless with ThinkPrime

Description:
The last few months have seen immense suffering and hardship from storms and flooding. However the outbreak of the Coronavirus has quite literally changed everyones lives and turned society upside down.
However, The Salvation Army is resolute and strong and just as we did in the Spanish Flu pandemic, and during the bombing and the Blitz we will carry on, doing what we can to support people and communities  in the ways that we can, within the Government guidelines.
In true Salvation Army Spirit, our greatest strength is our flexible, responsive local presence. Right now, each of our 650 corps and community centres will know exactly what the most effective things are to do. We are not just responding to the virus impact in one or two ways, but dozens and dozens of different ways, from food banks to counselling, from supporting NHS isolation units to checking up on people who are living alone
Please give what you can to enable us to help as many people as possible!
Title: Lyndon House Lifehouse Ipswich

Description:
Be a part of someone’s journey to a brighter future. 

Signposts provide supported accommodation to people who are homeless. Among the wonderful group of people are an array of skills and talents, our aim is to provide a culture of using and sharing these skills, together to create a great community.

If you are interested in donating on a regular basis or want to fundraise for us we would be delighted to hear from you. For more information please contact: info@signpostsso.org
Title: Shannon's Help the homeless

Description:
We are very lucky and have a nice warm house all year round, especially when it's cold and wet in winter. But some people don't and whenever we see homeless people we both feel very sad and want to help them.

We would like to raise £260.80 as this will mean 10 people can have a place to stay at Crisis for Christmas.

To raise this money we are going to be taking part in a children's mud run, tidying our rooms, cleaning our parents car and lots of other things.

Title: chloe's help the homeless

Description:
Hey y'all!

UPDATE!!!!

A huge massive ginormous and heartfelt hug of gratitude to the townspeople of Hythe today who have utterly made my day by supporting our busk for the homeless. And to the trusty and very merry band of musicians who all so willingly gave their time today - YOU GUYS ALL ROCK!!! - Today we raised......wait for it........ £224.94!!!!!! And with Tatt, Mike and Debs still playing after Terry and I left to get our glad rags on for our next gig, am sure that very grand total will increase! And!!!! Even more has been kindly donated online!! With every single penny raised being donated to New Forest Nightstop I want to thank everyone involved for raising so much for this cause ❤️🎄❤️🎄❤️

On 10th December I will be busking in the New Forest alongside a fabulous group of very talented folk who have generously given their time so that we can raise both awareness of homelessness and cash to help some of them out! 

We are busking to support Nightstop - the Depaul charity that provides emergency accommodation for young people across the UK who have literally nowhere else to stay.

All of us involved live and work here in this wonderfully 'prosperous' part of the UK, but even here in Hampshire, poverty and homelessness are a way of life for far too many people. 

In 2016 this is a disgrace.  Please help us do something about it!

Please donate anything you possibly can and lets make sure that not a single young person here in the New Forest is sleeping rough and alone this Christmas.

And if you want to come along and busk with us - PLEASE DO!!  Full details of where we'll be and times etc are on my facebook page :-)

Title: Michelle's Helping the homeless

Description:
Aslamualaikum (peace be upon you) 

The Prophet Muhammad (peace and blessings be upon him) said: “None of you truly believes until he loves for his brother what he loves for himself.”

Sahîh al-Bukhârî & Sahîh Muslim

The Prophet Muhammed may Allahs peace and blessings be upon him is explaining how important it is to serve humanity. YES humanity. Not just your fellow Muslims but every single human you face irrespective of their background. 

I chose to raise money for this charity because I have seen first hand how they serve people within the UK. They provide assistance to the most vulnerable in our community regardless of their background. How many of us are able to say that we are actually capable of doing this? This is why through donating you can be a huge part of this. 

The aim of this project is to provide assistance to the most vulnerable in our community, irrespective of background. The type of assistance will be based on individual case studies and typically may include financial aid, moral support and/or life skill training. Our intention is to seek the pleasure of Allah Azzawajjal by acting upon the numerous teachings of the Qur’aan and sayings of His Messenger (sallAllahu alaihi wa sallam) that exhort the feeding of the poor and attending to the welfare of the destitute.

After several years of feeding, the project has expanded across the UK. Some of the cities include:

Birmingham
Coventry
Sheffield
Leicester
Walsall
Bolton
Liverpool

Title: Homeless Appeal

Description:
For the past 7 weeks I've been out fighting for a Labour government, I've been out there because I believe it's unfair we live in an unequal society where millions are left fending for their lives whilst the rich get richer.

For one week I've decided to fast alongside my Muslim friends and work colleagues. Ive never done this before and it's bloody warm outside! All money I raise will go towards Shelter to help feed the homeless and to help those who live on the streets!
Title: Jordan's Fasting For The Homeless

Description:
So after my 39 mile run to Blackpool.. (just joking hobbled from Chorley and cried from Preston) I have decided to do another challenge to raise money and awareness for a different cause.

My company has recently become a patron for the BOLTON LADS AND GIRLS CLUB. I have just signed up to be a mentor for them giving young people the chance to talk to someone, rely on someone and have fun with someone. Not everyone is as lucky as me, I have a nice roof over my head, food in my fridge and a family who love me. I was completely shocked and saddened by what some of the younger children go through in their lives and how they still manage to smile through the pain.

SO. Something a little different to show my support for less advantaged young people.. On 1st September I will be sleeping rough and go by the name of 'homeless hunty' in order to raise as much MONEY and AWARENESS as possible. All proceeds to BLGC!

If anyone would like to donate please feel free, I will be based in Bolton town centre and would appreciate hot drinks throughout my luxurious stay on the cobbles! I will be there from 7pm right through until 7am!

Let's get sharing and donating guys! Text service will be up and running soon!!!!!!
Title: Cheryl's 'Homeless Hunty'

Description:
Thanks for taking the time to visit my JustGiving page.

My companies chosen charity this year is Centrepoint, who raise money for the homeless. I have offered to shave EVERYTHING (minus eyebrows) in order to raise money for our office. 

I have not been clean shaven for 5 years so being beardless is rather scary. Any donation is greatly appreciated, thank you in advance :)

Title: Homeless, not less.

Description:
Every year an estimated 3,500 veterans are failed by local councils when they ask for housing support.

The British Legion has estimated that there are currently 6,000 homeless veterans in the UK.

Thanks to Stoll and others, there is enough support to eradicate the problem completely.

Every night, there are 10,200 beds in the UK available to service veterans.

But too often local authorities are failing to ask homeless people if they have served — leaving thousands to slip through the net.

Help me to help Stoll continue their good work and hopefully many of these heroes who have served their country can be off the streets this Christmas.

Thank you.

Title: Portraits for Homeless

Description:
As a company that provides homes all over the UK with heating, we want to raise awareness of and help people experiencing homelessness.

The 13th of January is known as the 'coldest day of the year'. We are asking people to join us, donate and pledge to turn their heating off from 5-8pm on this day. You will need layers, hot water bottles and plenty of cups of tea... 

This campaign will be supporting our chosen charity, Crisis (find out more about them at the bottom of this page). We will also be donating a percentage of ALL boiler sales in January to the charity, and our team will be packing and delivering warm packages to their South Yorkshire base.

We encourage you to share your involvement, use the tag #heatlessforhomeless and let us know how you get on during your 3 hours of no heat.

Title: Homeless fundraising

Description:
Thanks for taking the time to visit my JustGiving page. I'm running 100km throughout September, to raise money for Huggard. 

I'm by no means a natural runner, so this is a real challenge for me!!! Please help in any way you can - it all counts & soon adds up. 

Some info about Huggard;

We are Wales’s leading centre for people who're sleeping rough and our Day Centre and Hostel are open every DAY of the year.

For more than 30 years, anyone seeking help and refuge from the streets have come to us for food, and a safe, warm place to stay.    

We are not a soup kitchen.  We focus on giving people who are homeless and vulnerable the support they need to rebuild their lives – to have a future again. 

Find out more about What We Do, How You Can Help us by making a donation, fundraising and volunteering, or how to Get Help if you, or someone you know, are at risk, or are homeles

Title: Paul's Help the homeless

Description:
MADM is a Christian charity supporting those homeless, in addiction, socially isolated, disadvantaged and in crisis in Maidstone, Kent.

MADM has a charity shop, furniture and electrical shop and an outreach centre. Some of the services provided include an open door policy to service users 6 days a week, emotional, practical and spiritual support, practical provision for life and home, financial support and crisis housing, match funding, signposting, collaboration with other agencies and local authorities, voluntary opportunities, street outreach, an outreach centre with household goods, food and toiletry bank, soup run counselling and prayer ministry.

Title: Russ's Photography for the homeless

Description:
Homelessness is a big issue in Oxford and we believe it is the responsibility for the privileged people to help with providing these basic necessities. To tackle this issue, all we can do is donate money on our part. 

So, we ( a group of 5 high school students) will run 50 km on Saturday, 7th April. The run won't be out in the field. Instead, we will run in our school; on a running machine. All we need is YOU to help spread awareness by donating as much as you like. 

Homeless Oxfordshire is working everyday to ensure that homeless people have a shelter over their heads and you can play your part by doing this small run.


This is an opportunity to make a difference.
Title: 25 kilometeres for the Homeless!

Description:
This Ramadan I will In'sha'Allah be in Pakistan delivering food packs and hot meals to the needy. Pakistan has always been a country which is always on a downward spiral and it's time to make a change and In'sha'Allah this Ramadan we will be feeding thousands thanks to you.

Title: Iftaar for the needy

Description:
Hi Everyone! Thanks for taking the time to visit my JustGiving page.

I am on a mission to feed 500 homeless people this Ramadan in London (Sunday 27th May 2018).

I would really appreciate it if you could dig deep and show your support to help me achieve my goal. Every contribution received will be going directly to feeding homeless people and to see a smile on their face.

Sleeping rough on the streets can be frightening, demoralising and isolating. Homeless people are some of the most vulnerable and socially excluded people in our society. 

Its really important to remember that there many people out there on the streets who are not even able to get the basics living in the UK or they do not know where their next meal will come from. 

What will the hot meal pack consist of?

The hot meal pack will have a hot meal (rice and veg curry - healthy version of course!) and a bottle of water. 

If I achieve my full target this will be enough to cover for additional items such as a personal hygiene kit and a blanket.

If you are interested in helping on the day to distribute these packs please feel free to contact me: honeyzaheer99@gmail.com

Advanced thanks from me - But first and foremost you will be getting the reward directly from God for contributing to supporting a charitable cause.

Not only will me and my team be handing out the packs - we will do so with a big smile. Remember a smile goes a long way!

I will also share updates with you on my progress to achieving my goal.

Please donate, share and spread the word! I'd really love for you to come on this journey with me so I can come back and say to each and every one of you "Mission Accomplished!"

Advanced Thanks to all that read this, contribute and help support me to achieve this mission.

Honey Zaheer

Title: T.A.W Helping the Homeless

Description:
Thanks for taking the time to visit our Just Giving page!

We are two local ladies who are concerned with the increasing numbers of homeless people on our streets in Milton Keynes. The problem just gets worse and worse. We have resorted to 'desperate measures' this year for our Christmas fundraiser, and plan to 'sleep with the homeless' for two nights, to raise essential funds for this amazing charity.

We will be meeting the victims of the system, people who used to have it all. We will offer food, supplies and a listening ear and let them know that although they might feel that nobody cares, there are people, like you and us, who do.

We know you will open your hearts to this worthy cause. You are welcome to donate either money to provide a bed for the night, or you can contribute warm winter coats, sleeping bags or food, which we will give out during the fundraiser. Follow our story on Friday 30th November and 1st December as we will be live streaming our fundraising endeavours.

Happy Christmas... care, have compassion and show courage x

Once you donate, they'll send your money directly to the charity. So it's the most efficient way to donate - saving time and cutting costs for the charity.

Title: Kim's Help the homeless

Description:
On my way home from watching Manchester United, I met a homeless person on the street.

I felt very sorry for him and wanted to give him some money but I didn't have any with me. So I decided to go home and tell my mum. Then we wrote a note to Mini Vinnie's, my school's charity group, about homelessness. I asked for everyone in the school to collect hats, gloves and scarves for the Salvation Army during our Christmas appeal.

After that, I also decided to donate £1 from my pocket money each month for a whole year, it would be nice if you could donate with me!

Zachary

Title: Hills Road Helping the Homeless

Description: Year 3 Yew class of Little London Primary School in Leeds have made it their mission to help the homeless. We have been learning about the housing crisis across the UK and have decided to help raise awareness and money to tackle the issues. Did you know that 1 in 200 people are left homeless? Therefore, we will be running 200 laps of the playground. Are you aware that 80 people in Leeds died last year on the streets? We will be stopping on every 80th lap and doing 17 sit-ups, jumps, step-ups or star jumps to honour them. This is because, 17.5 million people are affected from housing problems in the UK. Please give generously to help support this very important cause.
Title: Yew Class' Hustle for the Homeless page

Description:

I am a Yoga and Meditation teacher and at the end of each term (3 times a year) I donate all the proceeds from my last week's classes to charity. To date (Aug 2021) I have raised over £9250. I am delighted to be able to use my yoga teaching to raise money and awareness to help others. Please visit my website www.sarahgreenall.com to find out more.

Spear is a charity, based in Twickenham, which does amazing work to support people who are homeless or at risk of homelessness and helps people into education, training and employment. Spear's mission is "To enable people experiencing homelessness in South and West London to find secure accommodation and work towards a positive future." I firmly believe everyone deserves the safety and security of their own home and the opportunity to fulfil their hopes and ambitions.

Title: Alison's Art for Homelessness

Description: Homeless Oxfordshire is the largest provider of supported temporary accommodation for homeless adults in the county. Each night we accommodate 220 people. But we are more than bricks and mortar. Through 11 innovative projects, we provide the person-centred support people need to recover from homelessness for good.
Title: Love your Neighbours

Description:
Right now, we all know what its like to be separated from those we love. But imagine what it must be like to be facing that separation alongside the fear of becoming homeless.

Take one 20-year-old we helped recently. She shared a home with her grandmother, who urgently needed to self-isolate due to her vulnerability to coronavirus. But with nowhere else to go, she was faced with an impossible choice: move out and face homelessness or stay put and put her grandmas health at risk.

No one should have to make a choice like that  and that's why I have chosen to support Shelter's coronavirus appeal, I hope you will join me.
Title: I'm supporting Shelter's emergency coronavirus appeal

Description:
Thanks for taking the time to visit my JustGiving page.

In order to raise money for the homeless, I intend to go homeless for a week. Sleeping out and trying to avoid getting wet during the day.

I have become more aware over the years of how awful it is be to be homeless. I want to do more to raise awareness and money for those without a place to be. So I am raising money for Centrepoint a charity for young homeless people, and Soup N Sox, a local community project providing food, soup, socks, a sleeping bag..... Because being homeless doesn't just mean you haven't got a house to stay in, it means you lose access to all the usual means of being on the radar. You lose access to services, health care, to family, to regular hot meals, a hot shower, clean clothes, to friends, to support, income, and a warm safe place to stay. Not having a home is much more than not having a house. So I will not be in my house for a week, but I know I have the safety net of support if I need it.....and I will be home for Christmas
Title: Nigel's Homeless for a week

Description:
Aberdeen Cyrenians has been tackling homelessness for over 50 years. 

Starting life as a soup kitchen organised by Aberdeen University students, we now provide support and assistance to anyone experiencing crisis and at risk of losing their home. 

Through our community projects and residential services in Aberdeen and Aberdeenshire, we help rough sleepers, couch surfers with no permanent address, people who struggle to maintain a tenancy due to mental health and addiction issues, ex-prisoners with nowhere to go and those who flee from danger.
Title: James's Aberdeen homelessness

Description:
Crawley Open House is a local independent charity who have served the homeless and vulnerable for 26 years. Today we run a 24 bed high-support hostel, 4 move-on houses with 20 residents, a drop-in day centre, a crisis food parcels service and a community outreach team. No-one locally does more on the front-line to look after those who find themselves homeless or disadvantaged. 

We can only do what we do because of the support of the generous community around us, which is why we need your help this May.

Title: Paul's page

Description:
To fundraise for Crawley Open House's 'Hundred for the Homeless' project I have set myself a pretty tough challenge - to photograph 100 hundred favourite places and landmarks within Crawley, during May. I will then collate the images on my website.

I need your help - please let me know what you would like me to include; a bench in Tilgate where your husband proposed, the pub where you met your wife, a bus stop in Broadfield where you used to catch a bus to school, the street sign of your road, a playpark where you take your grand children or maybe your favourite cafe.  I will try my best to capture them all until I reach 100.

This is the reason why I am doing this: Crawley Open House is a local independent charity who have served the homeless and vulnerable for 26 years. Today they run a 24 bed high-support hostel, 4 move-on houses with 20 residents, a drop-in day centre, a crisis food parcels service and a community outreach team. No-one locally does more on the front-line to look after those who find themselves homeless or disadvantaged. 

The average length of stay in the hostel is 6-7 weeks. During that time staff work closely with residents and partner agencies to address some of the issues which made them homeless in the first place – maybe the debt, mental health issues, unemployment, trauma, addiction, relationship crisis, physical health problems or lack of life skills, for example. They manage to resettle around 60% of them to somewhere more permanent and appropriate.

They have remained open throughout the Coronavirus crisis, with a full hostel, 4 full move-on houses and almost 100 people temporarily accommodated locally by Mid Sussex, Horsham and Crawley Councils. Whilst costs and workload have increased it has been harder to raise funds and accept donations as a result of the pandemic, a lack of community events and the damaged local economy. Any
donations towards their vital work through the ‘Hundred For The Homeless’ campaign will therefore be massively appreciated.

They can only do what they do because of the support of the generous community around us, which is why they need our help this May.

Title: Simone's page

Description:
Alabaré urgently need your help

The homeless people Alabaré support are extremely vulnerable to Coronavirus; 75% of our homeless clients have underlying health issues* and many have no one else to turn to.

'Rough sleepers do not have access to the soap and water we are all using to help protect ourselves. They do not have the means to self-isolate. The vast majority are more susceptible to illness and many have complex underlying health problems. If the virus does spread, homeless people could be amongst the first to die.' Sue, Alabaré Homeless Service Manager

Please donate today and help Alabaré save lives.
Title: Coronavirus Emergency Homeless Appeal

Description:
Homeless Project Scotland is a fledgling charity, set up in October 2019 by a handful of volunteers that wanted to give homeless people on the streets  of our towns and cities hot drinks and food during the harsh winter nights.

Initially we set out with backpacks of flasks and sandwiches walking the streets of Glasgow and Edinburgh to ensure that anyone found struggling was able at least to get a hot drink and something to eat. Within a short period of time, we managed to recruit a team of volunteers who began to distribute a selection of food, essential toiletries and warm clothes.  We were  fortunate to enlist the support from major companies such as Aldi, Asda, Tesco, Morrisons and Marks & Spencer, who have kindly donated supplies of food which we collect  during the day and then distribute to homeless shelters throughout Glasgow, Edinburgh and Lanarkshire in the evenings.

Title: American Airlines Feeding the homeless

Description:
Shelley Pollard did not have a home, she was fighting against the freezing cold every winter, just a coffee or a blanket was not enough to save her life. She sadly left us on the 21st of March 2018. This tragic event happened a few month after a homeless man with beautiful soul playing harmonica in the street had his life taken away this winter.

I regularly talk to homeless people in the street and got to know their stories and situations. Most of them cannot have access to a shelter and are on a waiting list. They also lost their job because they do not have a home address and cannot have a house because they don't have a job. It is a situation with no end. But creating more space in shelters and projects such as a coffee that would employ homeless people could put an end to this situation. It is now time to save their lives.

To contribute to that change I am fundraising for Catching Lives with a song I wrote for the homeless. This song is called Gold. Gold because we should not see homeless people as vulnerable or inferior but as beautiful individuals with a soul of Gold. Homeless people deserve a life, a smile and love. They are our brothers and sisters. The lyrics of the song says "my tears have turned to gold" because no matter how much money a person may have everyone has a treasure of gold inside. Homeless people have gold in their heart and amazing talents but it is now time to see it and look beyond appearance. Everyone has a story behind their eyes.

You can download the song Gold just below and you can give as much or as little as you want ;)

https://soundcloud.com/flyer-tischa/gold


If you want to see the live video clip: https://youtu.be/hpBWP4b2C3Q

Title: Brads Homeless sleepout

Description:
This year I’ll be sleeping on the streets over Christmas to raise awareness and money for the Young Adults that have wound up Homeless. Many have ran away from home and are in hiding through fear.




The nights and locations are:


Christmas Eve - London


Christmas Day - Birmingham


Boxing Day - Manchester


I will be lucky enough to spend time with my family before and after these dates




In the uk today it’s been estimated that 83,000 Young adults from 16-24 are living on the streets.


The charity Centre Point is an organisation that actively looks for hidden homeless youth, helps them with health (physical and mental), accommodation, education and employment.




It’s gunna be cold, wet and over a time when people get together. If anyone wants to help please share or donate using this link!
Title: Brendan's Christmas homelessness

Description:
Thanks for taking the time to visit my JustGiving page.

As I am staying in Brighton to work over Christmas (with some of my lovely friends in the same position who are also on board), I have decided to dedicate some of this time to raise awareness to the unfortunate homeless population of Brighton.

Homelessness in Brighton & Hove has more than doubled since 2011 and the City now has the third largest homeless population in the UK. I'm sure those who also live in Brighton can agree that it is upsetting that these figures no longer shock us, as the homeless community is so evident whether it be when we walk to work in the morning or stumble home from a night out.

We will be street collecting this weekend and as it comes up to Christmas, volunteering at shelters to serve warm meals and generally having a little chat to some of these young people who are so much less fortunate than we are. All the money donated on this page will go straight to the increddible Clock Tour Sanctuary charity.

So for those students in Brighton who care for this problem as much as we do, we would love and appreciate just £5 that is left of your student loan (if even that!) or if not a share on facebook! £5 pays for a young person to have a shower, wash their clothes and prepare and eat a hot meal.

And for those who I miss at home, instead of sending a card this Christmas please donate the couple of quid here instead. It is going to a much better cause!

Thank you so much in advance and have a wonderful Christmas

Katie and pals x

Title: Charlie's help the homeless

Description:
My name is Gerard Boon. I am a partner and Financial Adviser of Boon Brokers, a financial service business in Norfolk & Suffolk. 

My primary job is to advise and arrange finance for those seeking to purchase property in the UK. It is a thrilling experience to help our clients achieve their goals and to see their faces light up when they receive the keys to their new home. However, due to the increasingly strict criteria of lending policies in the UK, there are many people who, sadly, we have to turn away. Often, this is due to no fault of their own and is merely the result of circumstance. 

The most extreme outcome of this lending rejection is subsequent homelessness. Due to the payment structure of our business, we are in the fortunate position where we do not charge any client fees for mortgage advice/arrangement. Procuration fee payments from lenders cover our costs. Therefore, many of our clients feel indebted after many hours of "free" service. With this Just Giving page, we hope to divert these feelings into charitable donations. From these donations, we aim to make a perpetual contribution to Homeless Link - a charity with the mission of ending homelessness. Over time, as our business expands, the donations should grow. 

The vast majority of mortgage brokers in the UK charge an average client fee of £500 (source: Money Advice Service). We are asking for voluntary donations of £10 from clients. However, donations from other parties are highly appreciated. Thank you for your time. I hope that you never have to suffer from homelessness - a growing reality for many in our society.

Title: Baby Bear's Helping the homeless

Description:
This winter it has never been more dangerous to be homeless. 

As the pandemic and cold weather continue, the large homeless population in Cambridge are suffering without shelter or support. Although many of us have returned home during lockdown, we still have the power to help prevent this suffering. 

We therefore ask that you use a little bit of your extra savings this term to help the most vulnerable in our community and donate to Jimmy's Cambridge through this fundraising page.

While £5 is the suggested donation, we understand that some people may not be able to afford this, so please donate what you can - everything will go a really long way and all donations are massively appreciated. Equally, if you can afford to donate more than £5, please please do!

For 25 years, Jimmy's has been providing help to people experiencing homelessness in Cambridge. They work with local people, communities, organisations and partners to deliver 24/7 emergency help, support and accommodation for those who would otherwise be sleeping rough. 

  • £10- Will pay for a welcome pack of essential items for a new resident
  • £20- Will provide someone with a week of hot meals
  • £50- Will provide someone in Jimmy's emergency winter service with a bed, a sleeping bag, clothing, an essential items package, hot dinner and breakfast, and support
  • £150- Will pay for a Mental Health Support Worker for a day

"I want to say a huge thank you to all of our supporters. At Jimmy's we work hard to put your donations to the best use in serving people experiencing homelessness in Cambridge. Together we are making a difference."
-Mark Allan, Chief Executive, Jimmy's Cambridge

Find out more about Jimmy's Cambridge through their website: http://www.jimmyscambridge.org.uk

Title: Help the Homeless this christmas

Description:
Over 300,000 people in the UK are either homeless or living in inadequate accommodation. 94% of homeless people are unemployed, 72% have some sort of mental health illness and 56% have a long standing physical impairment. So homelessness, either leads to or is the cause of mental and physical illness. This impacts on an individual’s ability to find employment and pull themselves out of poverty which in turn creates a perpetual cycle of deprivation.

Since 2012, As-Suffa Outreach have been working in the homeless space. To date we’ve served over 200,000 hot meals to the homeless across the UK, alhamdulillah. We provide not only food in the form of a freshly cooked hot meal, but also a warm and welcoming environment.

By Allah’s grace, we are now operating in 8 cities across the UK:

• Birmingham
• Walsall
• Coventry
• Leicester
• Sheffield
• Bolton
• Liverpool

Last year alone we served 40,000 meals across these sites.  This Ramadhan we'll be serving freshly cooked meals EVERYDAY from our Birmingham and Walsall sites.


How you can help:

Our service relies upon your support. Donate here to support the Homeless & Foodbank Projects.

Description:
Thanks for taking the time to visit my JustGiving page.

So on Friday, it is my birthday. I am very fortunate and lucky to be where I am and to be surrounded by such amazing family and friends.

On Friday, a few friends of mine and I will be driving around Wolverhampton/Birmingham providing meals for the homeless. No one is born to live rough and especially not to be alone.

This Friday, I wish to give to others on my birthday instead of receiving anything and just take the moment to appreciate what we have and the difference we can make.
Title: Friday Night Takeaway for the Homeless

Description:
In support of Crisis and the homeless, I will be doing a 10k this April in a self-isolated park area (originally held at the Olympic Park). 

For those who may not know, Crisis is a charity which helps the homeless who are in need, at risk, (and especially vulnerable more than the normal person during this pandemic right now). As Crisis explains: "People who are sleeping rough are more likely to suffer from respiratory conditions. They can’t wash their hands. And if someone is sleeping rough or in a crowded night shelter, it’s impossible to self-isolate." https://www.crisis.org.uk/get-involved/in-this-together/

Even without taking into account the pandemic right now, the sheer magnitude of homeless people across a lot of areas in UK is still drastic and the situation has not improved in the past few years; and those who are homeless deserve a better opportunity in life.

For just a few pounds, you are assisting Crisis in delivering essential basic packages to homeless people, mobiles for them to keep in contact and get important updates on health advice, and shelter to ensure no one is left isolated or in danger.

Once you donate through this donation page, JustGiving will send your money directly to Crisis (alternatively, you may also directly donate on their website). Thank you
Title: Ben's 10k run fundraiser for homeless during pandemic

Description:
It is very important to make people aware that it isnt just cities that have a homeless crisis, it is a problem nationwide that hits cities and towns and can affect anyone. We hope that this campaign makes everyone stop, think and take positive action against these social issues that can affect anyone of us, or our family or friends, at any time in our lives.

So if you want to help, please help spread the word, share our messages to educate our community, signpost people to our services, or if you can, why not donate or raise money through fundraising challenges to help keep these essential local services to reach those that really need our support.

Crisis helps to give people a new start in life and offer the support needed to turn their lives around. Ignorance is not the answer and we need to look after each other in this day and age. Charity starts at home but true charity lives in your heart.

Muslim Hands are coordinating with groups across the UK and worldwide to organise an efficient response to the pandemic, by working with local partners, food banks and their community kitchen in London.

How you can help:
Family Food Parcel  - £50 can provide a family food parcel, which will be provided both in the UK and abroad. This will help those who have lost their source of income and are isolated at home due to the virus.

Donate now!
