Title: Help the homeless this holiday season

Description:
Thanks for taking the time to visit our JustGiving page.

We would like to kindly ask that instead of sending us Christmas Cards this year that you would donate a small sum of money to those who are less fortunate than ourselves.

Each year, we always give to Crisis, and we would like to encourage you to do the same.  This is the invitation we received from them this year:

"Your donation of £26.08 will help us provide so much for our homeless guests: nutritious meals, health checks, clothing and haircuts, plus access to Crisis’ year-round services for support and training to leave homelessness behind in the year ahead."

We aren't asking you to donate £26.08.  Just whatever you can afford.  We are hoping by raising awareness, and by doing so, we can help at least 10 homeless people at Christmas this year.

If we can get to £260.08, which will cover the cost for those 10 homeless people, then we will personally donate a further £260.08.  Please help us reach our goal, and help those who struggle to help themselves. 

If you think this is a worthwhile cause, then please share with your friends and family.  And instead of sending Christmas Cards, which just get thrown in the recycling this year, perhaps you could ask them to share in your donation with just a few pence or pounds to this very worthwhile charity.

Thank you, and a Merry Christmas to all

Gary & Leeanne
xxx
Title: The Homeless Need Christmas Too!

Description: I have set this page up for anyone who would like to help our young and most vulnerable homeless, I am personally distressed by the footage I have seen regarding the treatment of our homeless in Windsor, to me this is nothing new but to many it may highlight how serious our homelessness situation is. I chose this charity as its aimed at preventing this growing problem our country is facing. Please instead of spending tomorrow sharing memes most people are just going to scroll past help raise awareness in a positive way and lets try and help get these youths the support they need. they really are the most vulnerable and the streets are the worst place for them, lets help them know they are not forgotten and we don't want them to feel abandoned anymore. Let them know we care............... Over 83,000 young people are experiencing homelessness right now.Violence, abuse, neglect and problems with mental health - young people often become homeless because it's safer to leave home than to stay. End Youth Homelessness (EYH) is a coalition of charities that provide safe and stable places for over 26,000 young people to live across the UK. I'm fundraising to End Youth Homelessness.
Title: HELPING PREVENT YOUTH HOMELESSNESS

Description:
Thank you for taking time to read this. I have been supporting homeless charities for sometime as through working and volunteering for various charities, I understand there is always a reason why someone sleeps rough in the UK and it usually relates to trauma, abuse and addiction. Therefore, along with 3 other ladies, we are going to be spending a night sleeping homeless in Bristol. This actually means finding a doorway to spend a night, working out where we can use a toilet and hopefully speaking to some homeless people and sharing their stories (with permission of course) with our supporters. I am feeling nervous about this challenge but these charities need our support more than ever.

Homeless charities work so hard to provide homeless people with night shelter provision,  food, basic items and ongoing support to help them more into permanent accommodation.  Caring in Bristol rely on charitable donations to support homeless people in Bristol and I want to take on this challenge to raise money and awareness of the fantastic work they do. Can you help?  Even if it is just £1 please sponsor me and together we can make a difference.

At the end of 2019 it was estimated that 320,000 people were homeless (according to Shelter)! It’s really concerning that Covid-19 is increasing homelessness and that the economic crisis will push more people into needing help in this area too.

Date of sleep out: 20th November  - our chosen charity: Caring in Bristol

What they do:  Provide shelter with beds and other easy access spaces, a night support team, food delivery, breakfast for homeless with some cafes, give out a handbook about services and support homeless people over Christmas, try to prevent homelessness. 

Please if you can  donate to my just giving page 

EVERYONE DESERVES A PLACE THEY CAN CALL HOME

More about the charity: Caring in Bristol work in imaginative and creative ways with people experiencing or at risk of homelessness, with the public and community partners to bring about lasting change in Bristol and beyond. Caring in Bristol are striving to create a society where everyone has a home, has hope and is part of their community. We don't believe that homelessness is a simple issue with a simple solution. Thats why we work across a number of projects helping people move away from the streets and preventing people becoming homeless in the first place.

https://caringinbristol.co.uk/
Title: Hayley's Homeless Sleep Out

Description:
The Whitechapel Centre is a leading homeless and housing charity for the Liverpool region. We work with people who are sleeping rough, living in hostels or struggling to manage their accommodation. We are committed to help people to find and maintain a home and learn the life skills essential for independent living. 

We work with over 4,000 people a year. Our projects reflect the diverse routes into and out of homelessness. A variety of services, in different settings, compliment each other and ensure no one slips through the net of support.
Title: Raising Money to end homelessness

Description:
You would not know the importance of the things you have except you meet someone without.

JOJO (Mrs Josephine Koroma) recently started as a team worker with Sisterland. This is what she said.

"My first night of assessment got me emotional and feeling pity seeing the uncomfortable situation homeless women are in. Homeless women have to deal with harsh weather conditions, disease, physical, verbal and sexual abuse, and many other bad things associated with living on the streets.

Furthermore, working closely with homeless women has taught me to be thankful for the things I have, especially for shelter. Because you see, my friends, you would not know the importance of the things you have except you meet someone without."

Title: Let's end homelessness in Wales

Description:
Thanks for taking the time to visit my JustGiving page.

It’s a real pleasure to run for Shelter.

I live in Hackney in London. Every day I see people suffering from homelessness.

I think it’s unacceptable that so many humans don’t have a place to call home, or even to sleep. We live in a phenomenally wealthy country and we have a responsibility to look after humans less fortunate than us.

I’m raising money for Shelter because I believe that everyone deserves a roof over their head.

Thanks for reading and if possible, donating.
Title: Dan is running to end homelessness

Description:
This year Blair Partnership are taking on lots of different fundraising adventures in support of Depaul UK, so we can help more young people like Dorian. Read his story below, and please consider supporting the team with any amount you can! 

"If you're here, it's not that you're making bad decisions, it's that you don't know how to make consecutive good decisions." 

Dorian's life was troubled from an early age. Finding himself homeless after a domestic row, he was at rock bottom and was referred to Depaul UK. Depaul does more than provide accommodation. They work with young people like Dorian to fulfill his potential and move towards an independent, positive future. 

In his own words: "With Depaul, they've helped me with budgeting. They've shown me what matters. Being here at Depaul, now, I'm more or less ready to move into my own place."

"I always wanted to join the Army, the Parachute Regiment.  I want to go further, like special forces. I've got loads of living to do."
Title: Ending Homelessness with Depaul UK

Description:
Damon, Darren and Sam have picked up a bit of (understatement in Darren and Sam case)  lock-down timber and all are unhealthily overweight, we have decided to motivate each other through a friendly competition of who can loose the most weight over a 4 week period. 

We will do a weigh in on Monday 27th July 2020 and upload our scores on the staff page, we will measure our overall weight and body fat percentage, who ever looses the most fat + weight between Monday 27th and August 24th, will be the winner. The winner gets to do the ice bucket challenge to the two losers. Which will run like this:

The 3rd place looser will have two buckets of the ice cold water poured  over their head after work (when all guests have left) on Friday 28th of August by the 1st place winner and 2nd place looser. 

The 2nd place looser will have one bucket of ice cold water poured over their head by the winner but only if we hit our target of £250 for our chosen charity.

This is all in aid of charity and a bit of fun for the team to witness. We would massively appreciate if you could support us on this weight loose journey and also put your hand in your pocket an help us try and beat out £250 target for St. Johns Ambulance Homelessness Initiative. I personally have been homeless before for a few weeks and I can promise you its one of the worst experiences you can ever go through so this really is an amazing cause to get behind and support. All donations welcome and watching us get freezing cold water poured over our heads at the end will make it completely worth it putting in a couple of quid to support us along the way, so anything you can spare will help for your entertainment! Much love and thank you for the support.




A little about St. Johns

The St Johns Homelessness Initiative is a joint commitment from all organisations involved in the development to contribute towards ending homelessness through; awareness-raising, inclusive employment, and fundraising. This is a pioneering project which has created a meaningful and sustainable model of collaboration between developers, contractors, supply chain organisations, the city Council and local charities. As far as we are aware, this is the largest single commitment from these industries towards the reduction of homelessness in the UK and we hope that it will be replicated. We are working with the Manchester Homelessness Partnership and Big Change MCR to ensure that our efforts and your donations are channelled to where they are most needed. This fund will support potentially hundreds of people who are homeless in Manchester and will prevent more people from becoming homeless.
Title: Alberts Worsley Homelessness Initiative

Description:
I am fundraising for End Youth Homelessness and our Independent Futures Partnership.

Every penny donated to this campaign will provide homeless young people across the UK with individually-tailored support to work towards their career goals, whatever their previous education or work experience.

For every £23 donated, we can provide an hour of specialist Education, Employment & Training services.

For every £1,200 raised, we can support a homeless young person into education or work.

Help us smash our partnership target and we can:

Provide over 4,350 hours of specialist services, which will support over 80 homeless young people into education and work, the surest routes to an independent future.

To find out the impact your support can achieve, please watch EYH's latest campaign video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Sad2Aj2gaI0

Title: Amelie - Sleep-out for the homeless

Description:
Church Homeless Trust supports approximately 3,500 homeless people each year, who live in supported accommodation across the country, by giving grants that meet an individual's need, whatever it may be - in order to help them turn their lives around. 

Sadly, homeless people remain one of the most vulnerable groups during the pandemic, due to the underlying health problems and compromised immune systems that a majority of them experience as a result of their unfortunate circumstances. 

At Church Homeless Trust, we know very well that lockdown has been a very difficult and trying time for those who were already vulnerable, due to their fragile mental wellbeing.

As wearing face coverings becomes mandatory as of today - little as it may sound, the cost towards a mask is an added worry for a homeless person, as they cannot afford very much due to their very limited resources.

We are therefore asking kindly, that if you can spare £3.00, to kindly donate it towards a basic reusable mask for a homeless individual. 

We hope you can help.

You can read more about our work at: 
https://churchhomelesstrust.org.uk/our-approach

Thank you so much for your support, which will make a difference.

Title: Karen's End Sleep Homelessness

Description:
Alabaré urgently need your help

The homeless people Alabaré support are extremely vulnerable to Coronavirus; 75% of our homeless clients have underlying health issues* and many have no one else to turn to.

'Rough sleepers do not have access to the soap and water we are all using to help protect ourselves. They do not have the means to self-isolate. The vast majority are more susceptible to illness and many have complex underlying health problems. If the virus does spread, homeless people could be amongst the first to die.' Sue, Alabaré Homeless Service Manager

Please donate today and help Alabaré save lives.
Title: Coronavirus Emergency Homeless Appeal

Description:
Whilst we are all tucking up in bed at night time theres a whole bunch of men &women out there trying to survive another long , cold night on the streets. 

Alot of people are very judgemental about these people and think that its there fault and theres no one else to blame. Theres so many different stories that have led to the countries population in homelessness to go up.

A couple of weeks ago we took food & water around to a big bunch of them and took time to listen to some of there stories as to why they have become homeless.

A lady we spoke with had a partner who everybody disliked , her family and friends disliked him. This lady said she loved him and lost her family and friends by continuing a relationship with him. A little while after she realised she had lost everyone and thought she had no other option than to continue a relationship with this guy and take abuse from him,  physical , emotional  and financial abuse. 

Years had gone on by and after a really nasty beating from her partner she knew she had to get out. Whilst he was asleep one night she packed her bag and she got out of there , she stated she ran as fast as she could , she never knew she could of ran so fast but adrenalin kicked in and the fear of him catching her. She travelled a good distance over a few days and has currently been on the streets for 14months.

When walking past and looking at these individuals none of us have any idea what they might of or have gone through.

Help us to help others !
Title: Sleeping rough for a weekend with the homeless

Description:
Hi, my name is Saul. We were involved in 'Children in Need' at school last week and it made me think about people who aren't as lucky as me. 

When I got home I wrote on a piece of paper about how I was going to bike 8 miles (not sure why 8). It's like going to school and back 4 times in a row and I can do that.

So I asked my mum if I could knock on doors and ask people to give me money so I could send it to the homeless. Mum said there was probably a better way of collecting money. I'm not sure how the money gets from the computer to the homeless, but she said she was sure it would get there.

So PLEASE can you send some money to the computer and I promise that before Christmas, I am going to cycle 8 miles. (In 1 go!). I think I might need a rucksack for snacks and stuff, but I'm lucky. I have those things whenever I need them. Lots of other people aren't as lucky as me.

Thanks for taking the time to visit my JustGiving page.

UPDATE 22.12.2020...

I have just completed my 8 mile bike ride for my chosen charity. It was a lovely ride through the forest. My bum was a bit sore by the end but I did it! Thanks to everyone who has donated to this cause and Merry Christmas :)


EYH - OUR MISSION:

We're working to end youth homelessness on a national scale    
to give vulnerable young people a future.

Before EYH was established, there was no UK-wide organisation for helping homeless young people.

End Youth Homelessness is a UK-wide movement of local charities that have joined forces to tackle youth homelessness together. It provides a national platform to raise awareness, share experience and generate voluntary income.

The funds we raise help our members to increase capacity, services and sustainability in extremely challenging times. Our member charities house and support over 30,000 young people facing homelessness.

Title: Stephen's raising funds for the homeless

Description:
Hi everyone, 


This Christmas I will be running 10km (hopefully under an hour) on the 30th of December to fundraise for St Mungo's - a charity aiming to eradicate homelessness in England. This winter is especially difficult for people facing homelessness due to COVID-19, so let's do something small to help. To give some further context of the need to help out, Shelter estimates that 280,000 people are homeless in England. In practice, this means that one in every 200 people find themselves without a home.

I'll do the run by myself and socially distanced of course. 

I'd appreciate all your support.

Thank you so very much for your donations.

It means a lot to me, St Mungo's and the people receiving their support!


Lots of love
Mariana
Title: Mariana's 10km to fight homelessness

Description:
The Curry Kitchen
The Curry Kitchen is a pioneering partnership project with Community Interest Luton, Venue Central, Discover Islam Information Centre and local businesses. Our aim is to provide hot meals to the most needy in Luton once a week.


We run a weekly Curry Kitchen service as well as delivering food prepared to homeless shelters in the locality. The project is sponsored by the local business community.

Furthermore, volunteers from various local businesses are on the frontline working together to provide hot meals to the homeless and most vulnerable.
Title: Curry Kitchen - Feeding the Homeless

Description:
Harvest is a time for giving, a time for thanks and for recognising and sharing with those less fortunate. At Turning Tides, we have always been delighted to attend and give thanks at Harvest services. Last year we received food to the value of £25k from faith groups and schools which fed local homeless men and women through the following winter months.

Covid-19 has presented us with challenges and we had to carefully rethink our approach to Harvest. Transporting multiple items from homes, to schools and churches and then on to our projects inevitably increases the risk of infection.

Financial donations will enable us to purchase essential items according to need and, crucially, plan carefully to provide enough food for our clients for the full year ahead. The donations will also enable us to buy fresh produce which supports better health and immunity at this critical time.

Donations can be to the value of a £3 shopping bag, or a £30 shopping basket, or a £100 shopping trolley.
Title: We are Hero's at Harvest for the homeless.

Description:
It's cold outside and those without homes, and in poverty, are suffering the  most. While it might not be easy for everyone to donate to a local food bank right now, a donation of a few pounds will go a long way to making sure those in need stay warm and fed, in difficult times such as these.

The Trussel Trust: Our vision is for a UK without the need for food banks. We say this because it’s not right that anyone cannot afford their own food. That’s why we are working towards a just, compassionate future, where no one should have to use a food bank to get by. Our vision is ambitious, but we know that if we work together it is possible. We can create a future where nobody goes hungry, because nobody will allow it – when we work Together for Change.#TogetherForChange

Title: Charmaine - STAYUP for the homeless 2020

Description:
LGBT people continue to face all sorts of issues, obstacles and real challenges as a result of their identity. We are disproportionately affected by mental health and homelessness, and the impact on young LGBT people can be devastating.  

Why the Albert Kennedy Trust? Because no young person should have to choose between a safe home and being who they are.

Did you know?

  • 24% of homeless youth population identify as LGBT (2015, AKT)
  • Centrepoint identified that 150,000 (approx.) young people are living in hostile environments / homeless (2016, Centrepoint)
  • 77% of LGBT youth homelessness could be preventable; as caused by familial rejection, abuse and ejection from home 
  • Impact on LGBT young people’s health, wellbeing, safety and life chances (education, employment) much greater than their peers
  • AKT’s Purple Door emergency and longer term housing project costs £100k per annum to operate (funded completely by corporate and individual donations).

The AKT is the national LGBT youth homelessness charity; focused on prevention and early action they provide: safe homes, mentoring, training, advocacy and support to young people who are homeless or living in a hostile environment after coming out to their parents, care givers and peers.

Right now 4,800 young lesbian, gay, bisexual and trans people are homeless or living in hostile environments. In most cases they have been driven out of their family homes because of parental rejection, abuse from within the family, and aggression or violence.

You can help the AKT continue its vital work - will you help me hit my target by supporting my appeal?  Donate today!

Title: Help Rune help the homeless!

Description:
This year I’ll be undertaking a small challenge during the month of December in a bid to raise money for the charity Crisis who are on a mission to end homelessness - I’ll be doing Murph every day for 31 days in a row.

Christmas for most of us is a time of happiness and warmth, being surrounded by friend and family, the out of control work Christmas parties, the joy of giving and receiving presents and tucking into some of the best food there is. 

However for those less fortunate this time of year is nothing to celebrate, as the cold kicks in and the nights get longer, sleeping rough becomes even tougher than it normally is. 

My hope it to raise as much money as possible for Crisis in order to help improve as many lives as possible during the winter months.

So a little about me: I own a gym called 7R with my brother which has been running now for four years. We recently opened a new facility in Woolwich last February and now run a CrossFit gym alongside our regular gym. I maybe however be one of the few CrossFit affiliate owners who doesn’t do CrossFit. In fact, since opening our new facility I’ve barely trained at all, so this should make this challenge all the more interesting!

I’m a firm believer that if you’re asking people to sponsor you or donate, you’ve got to do something that’s challenging. Ask any CrossFitter about Murph and they know what you’re talking about. Most boxes will do Murph once or twice a year and there is a palpable dread in the air in the days leading up to this workout. It’s a tough one - check the photo at the top of the page for the breakdown of the workout. To top it all off you have to perform the workout wearing 20lbs of body armour. I don’t think I’ve run a mile in total across the last two years so this should be fun!

My hope is that I can draw on the strength of the CrossFit community to raise awareness of this challenge and to raise as much money as possible to help the homeless this Christmas. 

Please do share this with your friends, family and with your gym/CrossFit box so that as many lives can benefit from this as possible!
Title: Raising Money For the Homeless At Christmas

Description:
In light of the fact we're moving into the festive period it's the perfect time of year to reflect and give back to society and think of those that are not as fortunate as ourselves.

Everyday many of us pass a homeless person on our commutes or going about our daily business. Many of these people have been forced onto the streets with no family or friends to fall to in hard times and there is just no way back. 

This Christmas sailthru wants to send some support and raise money for Crisis. By giving to Crisis this is what you will be enabling a homeless person this Christmas:

  • Welcoming support from people who really care
  • A chance to shower, freshen up and get clean clothes
  • Three nutritious hot meals including Christmas dinner
  • A health check and treatment from a doctor, optician and dentist
  • An introduction to Crisis’ year-round services for training and support for the future

Just £22.32 reserves a place for one homeless person. 


Just giving can be completely anonymous, so there is no pressure to participate and you can give what you feel comfortable with. You can also share this link to enable your family and friends to give too.
Title: Sailthru is supporting the homeless this Christmas.

Description:
Have you noticed there are so many more homeless on the streets of the U.K. right now? It's shocking. I run a project called Slipped the Net which is about building community around the homeless and so I am very aware of what is happening and it isn't pretty. Christmas is about luxury for those of us fortunate enough and so I decided to give up one of those luxury items this year in order raise money for Shelter. I will not touch a drop of ALCOHOL until 30 Dec and I want you to support me in this endeavour by donating a drink or a round to Shelter. Maybe everytime you buy a round you could donate the equivalent and buy someone a bed for the night. 

This won't be easy! I'm sure you concur. Wish me luck and pennies from heaven.

Description:

Title: Keeping the homeless safe at Christmas

Description:
Thanks for taking the time to visit my JustGiving page.

As Mancunians, it breaks our hearts to see so many homeless people on the streets, especially as Christmas is just around the corner. Please help us by sharing a little this Christmas and donating to our chosen charity, Lifeshare.

The Audioface Team
Title: Audioface: Helping The Homeless This Christmas

Description:
Harvest is a time for giving, a time for thanks and for recognising and sharing with those less fortunate. At Turning Tides, we have always been delighted to attend and give thanks at Harvest services. 

Covid-19 has presented us with challenges and we had to carefully rethink our approach to Harvest. Transporting multiple items from homes, to schools and churches and then on to our projects inevitably increases the risk of infection. 

Financial donations will enable us to purchase essential items according to need and, crucially, plan carefully to provide enough food for our clients for the full year ahead. The donations will also enable us to buy fresh produce which supports better health and immunity at this critical time.
Title: We are Heroes at Harvest for the homeless.

Description:
Thanks for taking the time to visit my JustGiving page.

The Canaan Trust work tirelessly all year to help the homeless... but imagine it’s winter, cold and wet! Heartbreaking to think human beings are sleeping on the streets. 

The igloo pods cost £110 and provide a dry, warm shelter - and this could save someone’s life!!

No one should die because they don’t have a roof over their head.... it’s just wrong!! 

Please donate £1 if you can!! And please share!
Title: Sarah's iGLOO Pods for the homeless

Description:
Thank you for taking the time to visit our JustGiving fundraising page.

A team from Lancashire would like your help to build a home for a homeless family in Iraq. 

Many families, including widows and orphans are currently living in dire conditions in makeshift tents on landfill sites. These tents have been constructed from rubbish collected from the landfill sites, and offer little protection from extreme elements. 

Each home costs £6,400. 

Please donate to this worthy cause and together we can provide at least one family with the security a home offers. Let's change their lives for the better.

We will keep you updated with our fundraising initiatives or simply make a donation via our JustGiving page which has been linked to the 'A World Without Barriers' Homes For The Homeless page.

Every penny counts.  May God bless you all for your generosity.and kindness.

Donating through JustGiving is simple, fast and totally secure. Your details are safe with JustGiving - they'll never sell them on or send unwanted emails. Once you donate, they'll send your money directly to the charity. So it's the most efficient way to donate - saving time and cutting costs for the charity.

To find out more about how 'A World Without Barriers' has helped change the lives of so many, visit their website at https://worldwithoutbarriers.org/ or facebook page at https://www.facebook.com/WorldWithoutBarriers/

Please donate generously and spread the word. If you are a UK tax payer, please tick the gift aid box as this can add an extra 25p for every £1 you donate.

Thank you for your support. 

Team Lancashire - Homes For The Homeless

Title: HELP THE HOMELESS: The Big Feed

Description:
Heart 2 Heart (H2H) is an ambitious initiative delivered by Gift of Knowledge, which is an educational charity (Reg no: 114328), that seeks to build stronger local communities in a very simple manner; through greeting and feeding.

The power of these seemingly trivial tools to connect the hearts of humanity are not to be underestimated. This initiative will help to forge new ties between diverse groups of people and initiate dialogue, and ultimately, improve the community’s civic health.  

So far,we have handed out roses to commemorate the 7/7 tragedy and fed over 300 homeless people across 6 London Boroughs on the same day, and launched a campaign to encourage the feeding of neighbors.

We would like to extend our help to those who are chronically ill, by holding small tea gatherings, or provide food to engage with patients and build stronger communities. Our network of enthusiastic volunteers will provide food and drinks and hopefully, make some new friends.
Title: Heart to Heart - Feeding the Homeless

Description:
Having battled with alcohol abuse my self, I felt it was time to take real action. Recently, I’ve received a lot of support from people close to me and it’s inspired me to try and help give something to those who possibly don’t have the same support network that I’m lucky enough to have. In the words of Jon Snow “Winter is Coming”! 

Anyone who knows me knows how painful this will be, I absolutely love a pint. So please know your donations will be hugely appreciated! 

The St Johns Homelessness Initiative is a joint commitment from all organisations involved in the development to contribute towards ending homelessness through; awareness-raising, inclusive employment, and fundraising. This is a pioneering project which has created a meaningful and sustainable model of collaboration between developers, contractors, supply chain organisations, the city Council and local charities. As far as we are aware, this is the largest single commitment from these industries towards the reduction of homelessness in the UK and we hope that it will be replicated. We are working with the Manchester Homelessness Partnership and Big Change MCR to ensure that our efforts and your donations are channelled to where they are most needed. This fund will support potentially hundreds of people who are homeless in Manchester and will prevent more people from becoming homeless.
Title: The St. John's Homelessness Initiative

Description:
Thought I would set this up to make things easier!

Given the collective decision not to give gifts this year, Hannah and I wanted to give the moment to the homeless instead.

So to make life easy, we've set up this page - the money will go direct to St Mungo's who are a charity that provide shelter and support for around 3000 homeless people a month - they are particularly active in this area too.

If anyone would like to donate via here then please do, all you have to do is make a payment and then Just Giving sort it all out and direct the funds to St Mungos :)

X
Title: COPCUTT CLAN CHRISTMAS FOR THE HOMELESS

Description: We are students from Longdean School and we believe that helping the homeless people of Dacorum is very important, but, we need your help. On the 26th of April, we are going to take part in a sleepout in the aim of raising money for the homeless in our area. Nobody should face homelessness and your donations can make a huge difference. All proceeds go to Dens charity so please be generous.
Title: Longdean School Homeless Sleepout

Description:
To raise money at this most difficult time I am offering a number of photographs for sale as shown in the Gallery, with all proceeds going to this cause. I will arrange for the photograph to be printed using an online company and place the photograph in 50x40 cm white mount and send it to you. 

Alabaré urgently need your help. The homeless people Alabaré support are extremely vulnerable to Coronavirus; 75% of our homeless clients have underlying health issues* and many have no one else to turn to.'Rough sleepers do not have access to the soap and water we are all using to help protect ourselves. They do not have the means to self-isolate. The vast majority are more susceptible to illness and many have complex underlying health problems.
Title: Coronavirus Emergency Homeless Appeal

Description:
Thanks for taking the time to visit my JustGiving page.

I think everyone deserves to feel safe.

From the reading the story of Noah for my bat mitzvah, I have learned the importance of having a place of safety, like an 'ark', when the world around feels like chaos.

It makes me so sad that people are sleeping on the streets of London not far from where I live. And I find it hard to accept that racism exists and that people are treated unfairly or unkindly because of where they were born or the colour of their skin.

As I grow up I want to do all I can to make life fairer for more people.

For my bat mitzvah I have chosen to raise money for charities that share my values. These charities do everything they can to help more people find a place to be safe, and to help increase fairness and equality in our world.

The charities are:

Stephen Lawrence Trust - fighting injustice & inequality

The Passage - helping homeless people in London

Tzedek - helping fight poverty & injustice around the world

One more thing - I would love your help in buying the whole store at ChooseLove - all items purchased go to help refugee families please let me know if you bought anything. Please also promise me you'll do all you can do stop global warming - let me know what you will do!

Otherwise just choose the charity you want to support from this page, and donate what you can :-)

Donating through JustGiving is simple, fast and totally secure. Your details are safe with JustGiving - they'll never sell them on or send unwanted emails. Once you donate, they'll send your money directly to the charity. So it's the most efficient way to donate - saving time and cutting costs for the charity.
Title: Help Sophie Fight Homelessness

Description:
This year Blair Partnership are taking on lots of different fundraising adventures in support of Depaul UK, so we can help more young people like Dorian. Read his story below, and please consider supporting the team with any amount you can! 

"If you're here, it's not that you're making bad decisions, it's that you don't know how to make consecutive good decisions." 

Dorian's life was troubled from an early age. Finding himself homeless after a domestic row, he was at rock bottom and was referred to Depaul UK. Depaul does more than provide accommodation. They work with young people like Dorian to fulfill his potential and move towards an independent, positive future. 

In his own words: "With Depaul, they've helped me with budgeting. They've shown me what matters. Being here at Depaul, now, I'm more or less ready to move into my own place."

"I always wanted to join the Army, the Parachute Regiment.  I want to go further, like special forces. I've got loads of living to do."
Title: Ending Homelessness with Depaul UK

Description:
We are doing The £1K Challenge! 

We're taking a stand against homelessness, and will try to raise £1,000 for Housing Justice in 1 year.


We'll be doing this by hosting quizzes, doing fitness challenges, virtual discos and much more!


The UK's homelessness crisis is worrying, especially considering the impact of Covid-19 on jobs. As such, we have chosen to take action, raising much-needed funds for tackling homelessness. 

Housing Justice play such an essential role in tackling homelessness in the UK, and thousands of disadvantaged people are helped by Housing Justice every year. 

I would really appreciate it if you could sponsor us. It's easy to donate - even on mobile - and every little helps. Thanks so much for your help! You can take The £1K Challenge too! Set up a fundraising page here: JustGiving.com/campaign/1kchallenge
Title: The 1K Challenge for Tackling Homelessness

Description: I'm running the 2021 Cardiff Half Marathon on Sunday 3 October.
Title: Help Manage Welsh Homelessness

Description:
Our Story:

Damon, Darren and Sam have picked up a bit of (understatement in Darren and Sam case)  lock-down timber and all are unhealthily overweight, we have decided to motivate each other through a friendly competition of who can loose the most weight over a 4 week period. 

We will do a weigh in on Monday 27th July 2020 and upload our scores on the staff page, we will measure our overall weight and body fat percentage, who ever looses the most fat + weight between Monday 27th and August 24th, will be the winner. The winner gets to do the ice bucket challenge to the two losers. Which will run like this:

The 3rd place looser will have two buckets of the ice cold water poured  over their head after work (when all guests have left) on Friday 28th of August by the 1st place winner and 2nd place looser. 

The 2nd place looser will have one bucket of ice cold water poured over their head by the winner but only if we hit our target of £250 for our chosen charity.

This is all in aid of charity and a bit of fun for the team to witness. We would massively appreciate if you could support us on this weight loose journey and also put your hand in your pocket an help us try and beat out £250 target for St. Johns Ambulance Homelessness Initiative. I personally have been homeless before for a few weeks and I can promise you its one of the worst experiences you can ever go through so this really is an amazing cause to get behind and support. All donations welcome and watching us get freezing cold water poured over our heads at the end will make it completely worth it putting in a couple of quid to support us along the way, so anything you can spare will help for your entertainment! Much love and thank you for the support.

A little about St.Johns:

The St Johns Homelessness Initiative is a joint commitment from all organisations involved in the development to contribute towards ending homelessness through; awareness-raising, inclusive employment, and fundraising. This is a pioneering project which has created a meaningful and sustainable model of collaboration between developers, contractors, supply chain organisations, the city Council and local charities. As far as we are aware, this is the largest single commitment from these industries towards the reduction of homelessness in the UK and we hope that it will be replicated. We are working with the Manchester Homelessness Partnership and Big Change MCR to ensure that our efforts and your donations are channelled to where they are most needed. This fund will support potentially hundreds of people who are homeless in Manchester and will prevent more people from becoming homeless.
Title: Albert's Worsley Homelessness Initiative

Description:
You would not know the importance of the things you have except you meet someone without.

JOJO (Mrs Josephine Koroma) recently started as a team worker with Sisterland. This is what she said.

"My first night of assessment got me emotional and feeling pity seeing the uncomfortable situation homeless women are in. Homeless women have to deal with harsh weather conditions, disease, physical, verbal and sexual abuse, and many other bad things associated with living on the streets.

Furthermore, working closely with homeless women has taught me to be thankful for the things I have, especially for shelter. Because you see, my friends, you would not know the importance of the things you have except you meet someone without."
Title: Helping Homeless Mothers and children

Description:
I'm running the 2021 Cardiff University Cardiff Half Marathon on Sunday 3th October for Shelter Cymru, due to the current covid-19 pandemic, Many people have lost their jobs and homes. Meaning they are now left homeless adding to the already crippling homelessness issue we have In both our country and the rest of the UK 

With your support I hope to raise money to help towards the massive war on homelessness in wales.

Wether it's £1, £5 or £10 No donation is to small and will be massively appreciated.

Thank you.

Lew x
Title: Lewys's Run For Homelessness In Wales

Description:
This has been a difficult year for so many people in so many ways. 

We decided that as part of our Christmas activities we'd like to give to a local charity and help make a difference to people in our home City of Leeds.

Our chosen charity,  Simon on the Street exists to provide support to rough sleepers and the homeless, who of course are particularly affected at Christmas time.
Title: Netpremacy, raising money for the homeless

Description:
Harvest is a time for giving, a time for thanks and for recognising and sharing with those less fortunate. At Turning Tides, we have always been delighted to attend and give thanks at Harvest services. Last year we received food to the value of £25k from faith groups and schools which fed local homeless men and women through the following winter months.

Covid-19 has presented us with challenges and we had to carefully rethink our approach to Harvest. Transporting multiple items from homes, to schools and churches and then on to our projects inevitably increases the risk of infection.

Financial donations will enable us to purchase essential items according to need and, crucially, plan carefully to provide enough food for our clients for the full year ahead. The donations will also enable us to buy fresh produce which supports better health and immunity at this critical time.

Donations can be to the value of a £3 shopping bag, or a £30 shopping basket, or a £100 shopping trolley.
Title: We are Hero's at Harvest for the homeless.

Description:
On Friday 19th November I will be taking part in the Wycombe Big Sleep Out 2021 to raise awareness to fight against homelessness on our streets.

Wycombe Homeless Connection helps people across south Buckinghamshire who are homeless, or facing homelessness by:

- stopping homelessness before it starts

- reducing the harm homelessness can do

- helping find homes for people who don't have their own

- defending the rights of people who are homeless or at risk of losing their home

We believe every person has worth, has a right to a home, and with your help we can make this a reality.
Title: Wycombe Homeless Connection's Big Sleepout 2021: At Home

Description:
Homeless Action in Barnet opened its doors in 1997. It began life as a soup kitchen and has developed into a fully-functioning day centre catering for Barnet’s most vulnerable people. In a standard week, around 250 people will seek support from the experienced staff at HAB - as well as help to find permanent housing, visitors are offered food, access to showers and clean clothes and company

Our plan is to have a sponsored Cardboard Box Sleep out. Scouts will make their own shelters using cardboard boxes, newspaper and plastic bags and sleep in them.
Title: 22nd Southgate Scouts Sleepout

Description:
Winter 2021-22 is going to be extra tough.

Wycombe Homeless Connection needs our help to make sure there will be help and hope this winter for anyone who needs it.

Locally, efforts to keep everyone in have just ended and more people will need a safe place to stay this winter.

The huge challenge they face is keeping everyone who doesnt have a home off the street, in suitable accommodation, with everything they need to stay healthy and well, while helping them find a more suitable, more permanent home. All this while there continues to be a severe shortage of suitable and affordable homes meaning moving on from emergency accommodation can be incredibly difficult.

The good news is because of your support, WHC can be here to help.
Title: Wycombe Homeless Connection's Big Sleepout 2021: At Home

Description:
Hi all, thanks for visiting my fundraising page. On the 20th November 2021, I will be hiking to the peak of Mount Snowdon in Wales (approx 14.5k total up and down) in order to raise money for the Single Homeless Project. As we approach Winter, the need for the homeless and vulnerable across London to be sheltered is more important than ever, and any donation would make a massive difference. You can find further information on the Single Homeless Project charity below. Thank You! 


Each day across all 32 London boroughs, our staff work with individuals to tackle the underlying causes of homelessness, such as poor mental health or drug and alcohol dependency.Often that means being there for people at a critical time whether to prevent their eviction or help them off the street; to get them into drug or alcohol treatment or support them with their mental health; or to help them find a job and a flat so that the so that they can take the final steps to living on their own.
Title: Hiking to Mount Snowdon Peak for Single Homeless Project Charity

Description:
Thanks for taking the time to visit my JustGiving page.

This is the fifth year I’ve slept out to raise money for CUF’s work.  Homelessness doesn’t disappear; it’s a hideous trap anyone,  but specially the vulnerable, can fall into, and once you are in it it’s hard to escape, without long term help, both material and psychological.  And sleeping out brings home a little just how dreadful it is.  Please help.
Title: Royston Rough Sleepers

Description:
Each year Canterbury Residents Group and Canterbury Community Group run a Christmas appeal for Catching Lives in Canterbury. Together, we've raised tens of thousands of pounds for Catching Lives every Christmas, so thank you for visiting and donating, it means so much to so many people. 

The true spirit of Canterbury is one of kindness and caring. Every year the number of posts in our group about the homeless grows, and so does the number of people that want to help.

Catching Lives provide support for rough sleepers, homeless and vulnerably-housed people in East Kent. Their centre in Canterbury is open 7 days a week providing services including: meals, laundry, change of clothes, mental health support, art activities and advice and advocacy. Their objective is to help people tackle their issues, access accommodation and find the motivation to move towards personal recovery and independent living. This includes mentoring; helping people maintain accommodation, and mental health support after they have moved on.
Title: Canterbury Residents & Community Group Xmas Appeal 2021

Description: HARP, Southend's homeless charity, helps local people overcome homeless for good. We provide access to accommodation, support and educational, confidence boosting activities to give local homeless people the best chance of leaving the streets behind. On average, we assist over 1,000 people every year who are either homeless or at risk of homelessness. We rely on the fantastic support of the public to carry on with our work. Thank you for supporting HARP and helping us to change lives.
Title: Cold Winter's Night - a song for HARP at Christmas.

Description:
THE BIG SLEEP OUT 2021

The Big Sleep Out is going to be very different this year, as Ian is going to sleep out on each of the Saturday nights in Advent. He will be using his tent to sleep in and will sleep at all of the churches in the North Cheltenham Team.  Ian is doing this as he couldn’t sleep out last year.  He will also be sleeping out on the 31

st

st

Description:
The Dons Local Action Group provides food parcels, household goods, furniture and appliances to those in need in our communities. We also donate laptops through our Keep Kids Connected campaign for children who need access to online learning. 

We work in partnership with a wide range of organisations throughout the boroughs of Kingston, Merton and Wandsworth in South West London. With their help, were building a diverse and resilient community network to tackle the effects of food, furniture and digital poverty.

Please help me raise money to support their work and the work of their partners who support the homeless in our boroughs.  

If you would like to take part in our sponsored sleep out, please register here: https://thebigsleepout.eventbrite.co.uk

Thank you for your support!!!

Description:
The number of people who found themselves sleeping on our streets increased each year from 2010 to 2018, with only a slight drop off in the last two years. StreetLink exists to help connect people sleeping rough to local support services by enabling members of the public to send an alert when they see someone sleeping out.

Since we launched, over 200,000 alerts have been sent about people sleeping rough and thousands of people have been offered the support they need to escape rough sleeping.

 Somewhere safe to stay 
 Companionship and support from volunteer befrienders 
 Essential food and festive treats 
 Phone and online support 
 Health and wellbeing programmes.

Title: Sponsor my volunteering this Christmas

CharityName: Room at the Inn - The Y Project
Description:
Thanks for taking the time to visit our JustGiving page.

For 25+ years St Philips Church Westbrook have taken to our local the streets with our Christmas float to collect money for the homeless and  to spread a little joy in our community.

Our local residents look forward to seeing and hearing our float in this annual event. Traditionally we have knocked on doors collecting coins but this year we will not be knocking on doors. You can still pass cash to our volunteers but in an ever increasingly cashless society we are asking for online donations. 

Room at the Inn is the charity that was launched after the closure of the old Warrington YMCA.

They provide daytime services to homeless and vulnerable people and a 20-bed emergency accommodation unit in Museum Street. Their ethos is to help people to access the services they need to go forward with their lives. Their dedicated staff and volunteers support people through very difficult times and help them to find a better future. Not everyone, without help, will be able to move forward because of the challenges that they have.

Description:
Over 83,000 young people are experiencing homelessness right now.

Violence, abuse, neglect and problems with mental health - young people often become homeless because it's safer to leave home than to stay. 

End Youth Homelessness (EYH) is a coalition of charities that provide safe and stable places for over 26,000 young people to live across the UK. 

I'm fundraising to End Youth Homelessness.
Title: David's Sleep Out for End Youth Homelessness

Description:
﻿﻿﻿﻿As a mortgage business we arrange funds for people to live in their own homes. Not everyone has a home and we have specifically chosen The Whitechapel Centre in Liverpool as our 2017/2018 Charity. They have reached out for our support and we are honoured to help them. We hope you can help us raise money for the Centre, in their quest to eradicate wholesale homelessness in Liverpool. Their offices aren't plush, they rely heavily on volunteers and this means more money can be utilised, to provide a better and more far reaching service to their clients in Liverpool.

Last year they helped 2,814 people - help us, to help them, help even more this year!

Thank you for your support.

Rob Killeen, Director, Capital Fortune

Description:
From now until december myself and the kids will be collecting clothing, food, toiletries and anything else that can aid a homeless person. Title: Sarah's Totally Yoga Helping Southends Homeless

Description:
It's been completely phenomenal seeing the momentum this petition has gathered. I've genuinely been bowled over by the many amazing comments and touching reasons you've been leaving for signing.

It's so clear that there's overwhelming support to find a long-term sustainable solution for people who are homeless and the government has misjudged the public mood by thinking that we'll let it continue.

In the meantime, so many national and local charities are doing incredible work in recognising that homelessness is the symptom and not the cause and in helping rough sleepers get back on track.

I thought it might be nice to make a JustGiving page to raise some funds for Centrepoint, if people would like another way to get involved. Centrepoint is the UK's leading charity for homeless young people. What is more, Princess Diana was a former patron of theirs, which seemed rather fitting. 

Any money you donate will go directly to them and the amazing work they do.

THANK YOU!

The boring bit...

CharityName: EACHa - East Ayrshire Churches Homelessness action
Description:
THANK YOU FOR READING, THANK YOU FOR DONATING,
THANK YOU FOR CARING!

Colleagues from Scottish Enterprise, AWD and Microtech in
Hill Street, Kilmarnock are doing what they can to support EACHa, East Ayrshire Churches Homelessness Action, registered Scottish Charity No: SC 036849, whose  mission is to help people at risk of becoming homeless, or who have been homeless and are trying to rebuild their lives. With around a thousand families or individuals in East Ayrshire becoming homeless every year, they look to provide tangible help that is complementary to the services offered by the council and others. 

As well as fundraising, we will be collecting items for EACHa service users in the form of items for wellbeing packs, good quality used
clothing and toys for children at Christmas.  Any donations collected
through this page will support the Lunch Club in Grange Street where they provide drinks and snacks and at New Laigh Kirk Hall in John Finnie Street which also has service professionals in attendance.

Title: Katerina-Newbury

Description:
Thanks for taking the time to visit our JustGiving page.

Every year the Chester Vixens like to give back to the community as a thank you for all the support we gain. This year we would love to raise money for CATH (Chester Aid to the homeless). CATH has 24 supported beds that operate under high demand and have a continual waiting list. CATH also welcomes over 500 individuals to it's day services. We want to help CATH as much as we can as it is still growing. We want to give as much money to support those struggling especially in these cold months.

This year we are continuing our support for CATH by taking part in our annual sleep out on the 29th November. At the sleep out, the vixens will be sleeping rough outside from 10pm-6am in a way to support the homeless community in Chester City centre.

Many thanks 

The Chester Vixens

Title: Chester vixens sleep out for the homeless!

Description:
It is hard to protect yourself from the coronavirus outbreak when you're homeless. People who are sleeping rough are more likely to suffer from respiratory conditions.

Crisis is the national charity for homeless people who helps people directly out of homelessness, and campaigns for the changes needed to solve it altogether. I'm raising vital funds to support Crisis in their work to help homeless people. 

For every donation made, we will send you a washable and reusable face mask sewn by me. The mask is made of high quality fabric, double sided and is washable. It also has a pocket provision for filter insert or even kitchen tissue paper.

Disclaimer:

Face masks are not effective on protecting us from the
virus. However, face masks combined with other preventive measures, such as frequent hand-washing and social distancing, help slow the spread of the disease.
Title: Charity in the time of the Rona- Helping the homeless

Description:
So as many people who are close to me know, Alex has always been my favourite singer, literally since I was a little kid and first heard 'Critisize'.

A week or two ago, Alex had gone on FB to say that he'd be doing an online gig to help raise money for Homeless Worldwide, they're a charity that was set up to help raise money for other charities. They include Shelter, The Salvation Army and Supporting Lives. Originally Alex was going to charge people to come and watch and raise money that way, but as it turned out, everyone got so excited he ended up waiving the ticket price.

Now, that's an absolutely amazing thing to do, but also means that we're going to have to work harder to try and help raise some pounds for some people who are in a really vulnerable position at the moment.

Homelessness is something extremely close to my heart, I've worked around them, spoken to them, helped them, given to them...you name it, I've done it. Most of the time, I think the important thing was is that someone noticed them...it often amazes me how they seem to be forgotten about, or looked down on. Everyone is always so keen to raise money for other charities, yet at times I think we forget there's so many people on our streets desperate for help. They're not desperate for handouts, just a roof once or twice a week, a warm shower, maybe a plate of food. 

So whilst Homeless Worldwide raises money for various charities and splits it, I've decided to focus our efforts on raising money for Shelter. 

I'm not expecting us to raise a load of money, heck, we've all got to look after ourselves too at the moment, our families, our friends, but even if we raised £25 and got one person a bed for the night, then I can't think of anything better, making a difference to just one person's life, even for a short space of time...what could be more important than that. 

We're living in a time where we've all got to pull together, we've got to look out for one another and be there as much as we can. Sometimes that means a phone call, sometimes it means raising a bit of money for an extremely important cause.

So on the 30th of May at 10:00pm, join Alex, me, and everyone else who loves a good time, AMAZING music and the joy of being together without being together!

"It's gonna be kinda right!"


http://twitch.tv/officialalexanderoneal


Love you guys and love you Alex for doing this, hopefully we can help a little.


Stu x
Title: Stu's Alexander O'Neal Live To Help The Homeless

Description:
Thanks for taking the time to visit Sheffield As Suffa's JustGiving page.

The Sheffield As Suffa Team is raising funds to provide dry food packs and essentials to the homeless and people in temporary accommodations during Covid 19 crisis. 

Each pack costs £10 and we want to provide 50 packs, so a total cost of £500.

Each pack contains:

- Bodywash
- Deodorant
- Toothpaste
- Toothbrush
- pack of socks
- pack of Oats bars
- 2 pot Noodles
- 1 Instant porridge
- 1 pasta pot

Please help us reach our target by donating or sharing with family and friends. Jazak Allah Khair.

Title: Antony-Roberts2021

Description:
Before the pandemic, 121,000 young people, aged between 16-25 years asked for help with homelessness in the UK and we only expect that number to get worse. 

Rising youth unemployment, strained family relationships and domestic violence made worse due to the lockdowns, an increase in young people calling for help with their mental health  the most vulnerable young people really are facing a crisis. But there is hope. 

With the right opportunities and support, homeless young people can turn their lives around and build successful futures. They just need a little help, the kind of help that End Youth Homelessness Member Charities provide. That's why on 12th November I am giving up my bed to raise the money and awareness needed to transform their lives.
Title: B&B Bristol - Jess

Description:
I am fundraising for End Youth Homelessness and our Independent Futures Partnership. 

On Thursday 21st October, I will be participating in EYH's Sleep Out Challenge by spending the entire night at Lloyds Amphitheatre Bristol. I will be sleeping rough and then go into work the next day with little or no sleep, in order to get a glimpse on what it must be like to be homeless.

Under 25s will be the worst hit financially by Coronavirus. They are the group most likely to suffer now and after the pandemic. They are the most at-risk of long-term disadvantage, of poor mental health and of losing their jobs.

Every £100 raised will pay for four nights in a warm, safe room for a homeless young person, where EYH can give them support they need to turn their life around. Now more than ever homeless young people need our help!!!Please donate to this fantastic cause!!#endyouthhomelessness

Without the right help at the right time, this downward spiral lasts through to adulthood. It is estimated that 50% of homeless adults become homeless before the age of 21. But there is still hope. Description:

Title: Isabelle and Tony s raising  money

Description:
Thank you for taking the time to visit this fundraising page.

I have been involved with Lifeshare since 2018, a brilliant voluntary organisation established to help meet the needs of homeless and vulnerable people in Manchester and Salford. This year, thanks to the pandemic, most of us are having a virtual work Christmas party so Secret Santa is that bit harder to do. This led to a simple idea...

All those tenners we would normally spend panic buying some bubble bath for that colleague you don't know very well could be better spent this year by a charity. I wondered how much we could raise if we made this simple swap and how much help that would be for a charity like Lifeshare. 

It is estimated that 1 in 154 people in Manchester are homeless and there is currently a plan on the table in Greater Manchester to apply cutbacks worth £2.8m within its homelessness service. 

Through helping out at their breakfast project (serving breakfast each weekend to homeless people in central Manchester) I have seen firsthand how much a warm meal and a drink can go a long way. Why are we using these tenners on lackluster gifts when we could be helping those who really need it? 

The money will go to providing hot food and drinks plus warm clothing to keep homeless people comfortable through the winter. 

I hope you can join me in my mission to raise some cash for this fantastic charity. I cannot imagine being homeless at any time of the year, but it must be so much worse during the winter and at Christmas time. 

You can find out more about Lifeshare's work here: https://www.lifeshare.org.uk/
Title: Manchester's Secret Santa Homeless Fundraiser

Description:
Brighton Housing Trust is a charity close to our hearts, doing fantastic work supporting homeless people in the city and across Sussex, providing them with food, clean clothes, hot showers, healthcare, mental health support and more. Last year the charity's advice services prevented nearly 1,000 households from becoming homeless. 

This year has been particularly tough for BHT and the people it supports, with many fundraising events cancelled. The money we'd usually spend on Secret Santa gifts could make a real difference. 

  • Just £5 could pay for hot drinks for the rough sleepers who visit First Base each morning after a cold night sleeping on the streets
  • £10 could cover the cost of a meal, clean clothes and hot shower for someone sleeping rough
  • A donation of £25 could run a support session for young people experiencing mental health problems. 

So give what you can, and Propellernet has kindly promised to match whatever we raise. Let's spread the Christmas joy and raise some cash!

Find out more about the First Base Centre here: https://www.bht.org.uk/services/homelessness/first-base-day-centre/ 

For more information on the BHT Christmas Appeal: https://www.bht.org.uk/fundraising-event/christmas-2020/
Title: Propellernet's Secret Santa Homeless Fundraiser

Description:
Last year, food banks in our network provided more than 1.6 million emergency food parcels to people in crisis. More than half a million of these went to children. It’s not right that people can’t afford the basics. 

With your help, we can help end the need for food banks.As a nation, we expect no one should be left hungry or destitute. Illness, disability, family breakdown or the loss of a job can happen to any of us. Please help the vulnerable, homeless, jobless, needy, elderly and children, who may go to bed hungry during this crisis. If no help is provided.

With your help #ThisCanChange #FightBackHunger #FightFoodCrisis #CoronavirusLockdown

Title: No one should have to suffer being homeless this Christmas and many more

Description:
The Sweet Rainbow team is a group of university students who wants to share more love by taking part in the £10 challenge with LSBU and the Institute of Directors to raise money for Centrepoint.

Centrepoint is the UK's leading youth homelessness charity, supporting more than 15,000 homeless 16-25-year-olds every year. Their aim is to ensure that every young person leaves Centrepoint with skills, a job and a home of their own. Centrepoint research estimates 103,000 young people in the UK asked for help from their local council in 2017/18 because they were homeless or at risk of homelessness.

To raise money, we will be holding a bake sale with homemade cookies (see pictures below for examples of cookies we will be selling) at LSBU on Wednesday, 19th of February 2020, in the Student Life Centre, between 08:00am - 12:30pm. All the money will be given to Centrepoint!

We would like to encourage everyone to share more love, especially around Valentines! All donations - big or small - are encouraged to make a difference.


Thank you for taking the time to visit Sweet Rainbow's JustGiving page!

Title: Team Sweet Rainbow

Description:
The coronavirus pandemic has led to widespread consumer panic, driving prices and leading to massive shortages in essential products. Whilst for most people this is an inconvenience, for the most vulnerable members of society, this poses a genuine threat to their physical and economic safety.

In these times, more people than ever will be turning to homeless shelters and food banks. However, the rising prices and shortages mean that these causes are under an incredible financial pressure that the vast majority of these charities cannot shoulder. This means the vulnerable members of our communities will have nowhere left to turn.

However, we can make a genuine difference. By surrendering some of the stockpiles you may be privileged enough to have compiled, or donating your daily coffee money, you can make a real difference and support those charities that are going to be under the most pressure in these difficult times. Not only does this allow you to proactively mobilise on your concerns, but it will create an immediate physical and financial impact on the community.

As well as this page, we will also be running a food bank at Hills Road Sixth Form with the intention to bring the donations to local food banks. Please do what you can to make an enormous difference in your local community.

--

Description:
Food For Thought - Feeding the Homeless

Food For Thought is a new family funded project whose aim is to provide one hot meal a week to the less fortunate in their local area/community – Blackburn. Food for Thought is an organisation there to cater to all, regardless of race, religion gender or age. 

The idea was inspired by the food banks, but this family wanted to bring in their new approach and serve ‘hot wholesome’ meal, once a week, enabling those who cannot afford hot meals to eat at-least one nutritious meal a week.

Food For Thought initially started as a family project in association with Al Imdaad Foundation, who helped get the project off the ground. The project is currently funded by family members, but as the demand increases, Food For Thought will be looking for external support to widen our horizons and keep the project running.

The aim of this project is to provide hot wholesome nutritious meal once a week to those who are in need and living in current economical/financial difficulties where they have no means to get hot food. All meals will be prepared by two family catering businesses. Once the food is prepared it will be delivered to the Al Imdaad Foundation site, at 185 Audley Range, Blackburn, BB1 1TH where friendly volunteers will help distribute the foods. Our intention is to keep Al-Imdaad Foundation as the main and central location, but hopeful to set up the distribution bank at other areas, where it’s convenient for others to get too.  

The project we would like to expand further however we can only do this with your support, kindly donate whatever you can towards this noble project.
Title: Food For Thought

Description:
This Boxing Day, Chris, Barny and Cathy will be hitting the streets of Central London with a makeshift soup kitchen in the back of 'The Bongo', to give out hot soup, Christmas snacks, doggy treats and blankets to the homeless.

On Boxing Day we'll be mobile around central London in the morning and then pitching up near Trafalgar Square, if you wish to support us on the day please come along with your warm heart and whatever wish you wish to donate.

We've had lots of generous donations from friends already, including soup, blankets, dog food, sleeping bags and serving equipment. Thanks so much to everyone who's helped us so far!

For those of our friends who are simply too far away and would like to help please donate what you can to Crisis.

And for those only able to support in spirit, we would be grateful if you can share our plight with your friends to help raise awareness of the homeless crisis this Christmas.

Thanks so much,

Chris, Barny & Cathy

Title: Summerfield Cares

Description:
Imagine you and your family waking up in in freezing weather, snow or ice, or in temporary shelter and are starving. There are over 300,000 people in the UK who are homeless or sleeping rough. London has 4 times more than Scotland and Wales combined according to Shelter Charity's finding as reported in The Guardian. Many of these are families. 

There is so much food that goes to waste which is why we love what City Harvest London does. They collect & repurpose food that would have otherwise been thrown out.

It was started by the amazing Laura Winningham, who has built something seriously spectacular. Started only a couple of years ago- City Harvest London collects food from restaurants, food markets, and grocery stores & have repurposed over 600 tonnes of food to feed the homeless. 

Is it any wonder that many huge names have gotten behind them by donating food, vans and more! They count amongst their supporters Sainsburys, Marks & Spencer, Ocado, Nandos, Vauxhall cars (who supply vans) & shedloads more.  But they need much more help to get more food to those in need. 

This charity has won many awards for their work supporting our beloved London community and those in need. They have a huge heart and an amazing team of people. Check out their site and you will see how fantastic they are. They feed tens of thousands of Londonders (including families) who are hungry, homeless and in compromised situations on a regular basis. 

Your donation will go towards collecting food, delivering it, and having teams visit the various shelters and areas where the homeless are, bringing food, hot drinks & lots of love. THANKS SO MUCH FOR YOUR HELP!

We at Unbeelievable Health have huge admiration for this charity & hope you will help out and share this with your friends, family and on social media. Why not email this link to your contacts? 

Many of you helped us help City Harvest out here during The Grenfell Tower disaster and we were all SO GRATEFUL! Your help made a HUGE DIFFERENCE! Let's muck in to help ensure a bunch of people feel a little less hungry & a bit more cared for! 

Many thanks!!

Sarah Orecchia, Unbeelievable Health Founder & The Unbeelievable Health Team

Description:
Twenty four hours a day, every day of the year. The Salvation Army provide care and support to people in need. In fact its what we've done for over 150 years. It is what we continue to do today and its what we will go on doing whenever and wherever there is injustice and pain in the world.
We help people affected by disasters or financial troubles.  We help people who are experiencing homelessness or escaping violence  We help people trapped in addiction or battling mental illness  We help anyone feeling hopeless.

We are a community- a movement of people fighting injustice. Our donors and supporters- people like you- are as much a part of The Salvation Army as those working in our recovery centres or regional communities. Together we offer unconditional love and support, without discrimination. 
The Salvation Army is committed to delivering innovative and progressive services that empower people beyond their circumstances.

Description:
I will be DJing for 24-hours non-stop from 8pm on Friday 5th Feb right through until 8pm on the Saturday evening!

The amazing team at Helping our Homeless Wales need our support - the van which they use to deliver vital food and supplies all across Wales and into Herefordshire is knackered and has to be replaced - I want to help them raise the £3,500 they need.

With lockdown 3.0 in full effect, staying in is back as the new going out, so I’ll be doing my best to put some much-needed sparks on your (indoor, socially distant) sparklers!

I will be streaming live from The Globe in Hay via my Mixcloud page from dusk until dawn and then back to dusk again, with a very special and very, very extended set. As well as the usual dance-floor bangers, disco debauchery and high-energy party house, I will be taking you on a cosmic journey via the best in soul, reggae, D&B, 90’s trance and even some ’80’s re-edits! 

In return please can you donate what you can to the appeal through this page and help us smash the target.

As part of my set from 2pm - 4pm on the Saturday afternoon I will be switching across to host my new radio show on the EXT Radio Mixcloud page for a couple of hours which I’m super excited about - let’s hope I’m still awake!

So dig out your glad rags, dust off your dancing shoes, grab your cocktail shaker, plug in your disco lights, tell your mates and get involved!
Title: 24-Hour Kitchen Disco Live DJ Stream!

Description:
Running is definitely not my thing (at all...) but every couple of years I seem to end up involved in some sort of running event (evidence in gallery). This year it is the Hackney Half marathon for the amazing work of the North London Action for the Homeless.

Not only do they provide nutritious vegetarian meals twice a week as well as food packages, but also provide services like showers, clothes washing, haircuts and run a garden activity.  This all creates an incredible community for both the guests as well as the volunteers (like me!) who regularly attend to serve food and prep meals.

It's a very small charity so it really relies on the kindness of donations, so if you have any pennies or pounds you can spare, please do donate!

Thank you!

Title: Paul's Dry December

Description:
TOGETHER LET'S FEED THE NATION IN ISOLATION

UPDATE: WE HAVE PRODUCED AND DISTRIBUTED OVER 500,000 FOOD PACKS SO FAR DURING THE CORONAVIRUS CRISIS. WE HAD AN INITIAL TARGET OF PRODUCING 3000 FOOD PACKS PER DAY BUT THIS QUICKLY RAMPED UP. WE ARE ALSO DISTRIBUTING NON-PERISHABLE FOOD NATIONWIDE. WE NEED YOUR SUPPORT TO HELP US  KEEP THIS VITAL SERVICE GOING FOR AS LONG AS IT IS NEEDED, AS WELL AS SUPPORTING SOCIAL BITE'S WORK IN THE LONG TERM. 

We want to tell you about how we have been affected by the COVID-19 outbreak and how we plan to respond  - hopefully with your support. 

Like with every hospitality business all over the world the Coronavirus outbreak has put Social Bite's future into great uncertainty. We currently operate 5 social enterprise cafes where we offer free food to those in need and 1 in 3 of our workforce have struggled with homelessness. All of these cafes, as well as our corporate catering business, have been forced to close during the outbreak.

Furthermore, the homeless and vulnerable people we support on a daily basis will be the worst affected by this crisis. Imagine being homeless, having no option to self isolate or stock up on supplies, with many support services you were relying on closing down. Alongside homeless people there will be thousands more people who end up in food poverty, families who were relying on free school meals and those who have just been made redundant due to the crisis.

We thought long and hard about how to respond to this to best help these people in desperate need, whilst trying to minimise staff redundancies and protect the future of Social Bite. The below is our solution and we are asking for your support to deliver it:

Since Friday 20th March we have re-purposed our entire organisation to create a nationwide food delivery service. Our kitchens, cafes and teams have been entirely re-deployed to produce and deliver food and supplies to those who need them most for the duration of this outbreak. We are working with partners to ensure that food and essential supplies can reach the following people

- Homeless People

- Families that were relying on free school meals and now have no access

-Those who have been made redundant due to the crisis and are in food poverty


Your support will help us to:

- produce and distribute thousands of food and essentials packs every single day for as long as is needed.

- Distribute non-perishable food and make donations to food-banks throughout the UK during Covid-19

- Support Social Bite to help homeless people with long term projects after the Covid-19 crisis ends


Thank you in advance for your compassion and support in this incredibly difficult and uncertain time.
Title: Feed the Nation in Isolation
