Description:
My fundraising challenge is to donate £40 worth of hot food and drink to as many people as I can within 3-4hrs on Saturday 12th January. All donations will go towards the charity, and the food that I will be providing to people will be funded by myself. 

Huggard do so much to help and support people in need, especially in the cold winter months. They provide public access to; night centres, the Huggard Cafe, housing, tenant support, training and social enterprise schemes, substance abuse services and advocacy services.

Huggard Client’s backgrounds:

50%+ of those accessing Huggard’s services are under 35.

35% have been in Local Authority care

20% have been in the armed forces

50% have been a victim of violent crime or domestic violence

20% have experienced the death of loved one

Description: Jan 2017 Meryl set up Newbury Soup Kitchen. It is a voluntary organisation providing help and support to the local homeless, rough sleeper community and those less fortunate. Description:
Over 180,000 people have fled from bombings around areas of Idlib. Families are sleeping in fields and forests with little or no food or water.

One Nation have launched an emergency appeal to provide emergency shelter packs for families, widows and orphans.

£350 pack includes:

  • Large shelter
  • Food parcel for a month
  • 4 Hygiene kits
  • Water bottles

Over 750,000 people have been displaced in early 2020 and are sleeping rough in fields and forests with no food or clean water.

We are now building emergency homes to provide a rapid, safe and secure housing solution. These homes will also have their own kitchen, internal toilets and a washroom.

£500 home (42-m2) including 2 rooms, kitchen and bathroom

£50 - Food parcels for a month including

- 4 Hygiene kits

- Water bottles

Lets raise enough for 300 families

Please donate, set up a fundraising page, share the link with friends and family.

Title: 1000REPS4HOMELESS

Description:
For a number of years now, I have been running a scheme to help raise money for the Crisis at Christmas appeal, where staff can donate money to Crisis instead of sending Christmas cards to colleagues.

For the past 40+ years Crisis have been opening centres across the UK at Christmas. They are the UK’s largest Christmas volunteering project, with over 10,000 volunteers.

Crisis is a national charity dedicated to the relief of poverty and distress among single homeless people. Their mission is to end street homelessness through practical action to help homeless people move towards a secure, sustainable home.

If you are able to donate, please fill in the Gift Aid Declaration, as this will enable Crisis to reclaim, from HMRC, basic rate tax on your gift. Please remember to tick the box if you prefer not to receive further communications from Crisis or Just Giving.

Last year we raised £235 - let's see if we can make it £250 this year!

Have a look at the Crisis website (http://www.crisis.org.uk/) for more information on their work.

Many thanks

Matt

Title: Netball do Living Below the Line

Description:
This year, we have been blown away by the generosity of the community and local people. You have helped us vastly exceed our 25th Anniversary Fundraising Target, and your donations have better enabled us to cope with the increased demand for our services in this unprecedented year.

This Christmas, housing crisis and poverty is a reality for growing numbers of local people.

On-going causes of homelessness and housing crisis, such as domestic violence, familial breakdown or financial difficulty, are still the cause of suffering for so many. However, this year, more families and individuals than ever are facing the consequently of redundancy, furlough, isolation, ill-health and economic crisis.

This increased suffering if demonstrated in our enquiries throughout the year. For example, June 2020 saw a 94% increase compared to June 2019. A few months on, in September 2020, enquiries still remain 84% higher than in September 2019.

But, because of the fantastic support we have received, we believed it was time for our staff to get stuck in too! 

Between 25th November and Christmas Day, the staff of The Bridge will be completing the Staff Santathlon: a team effort to travel the equivalent distance of Lands End to John O'Groats!

That's one month to WALK, SWIM, CYCLE or RUN a total of 1,407 kilometres. 

And so, it seemed fitting to set our target of £1,407.

 That's just £1 for each kilometre, that together will make an enormous difference to the lives of the families and individuals in our services. 

To track our progress, we will be regularly updating our page with evidence of our efforts, via apps such as Strava, FitBit, Garmin and more.

We know that this year is incredibly tight for many of us. But, little or large, every donation you provide towards our Staff Santathlon will go towards changing the lives of local people facing homelessness, housing crisis and financial difficulty.

Find out more about our services, such as Family Mediation, Housing Advice, Tenancy Support and Food Parcels, on our website.

https://www.thebridge-eastmidlands.org.uk/
Title: The Bridge Staff Santathlon | Christmas 2020

Description:
Rough sleeping

Analysis of Scottish Household Survey data suggests that around 5,300 adults sleep rough at least once a year in Scotland: this equates to an estimate of just over 700 people on a typical night. Rough sleeping is primarily concentrated in Scottish cities.

Steps to Hope SCIO regularly do coffee runs in the city centre of Edinburgh bringing hot drinks to those sleeping on our streets. A lot of the people we see suffer from addiction but have no resources or support to get the help they require. So as well as delivering hot drinks we also give them our information which could lead them to a clean and sober life as well as getting housed.

Steps to Hope is making an appeal to help raise funds so we can have a catering van on the streets of Edinburgh. This van will do routine stops offering hot food and drinks to those sleeping rough, as well as giving out vital support which could save lives.

We are a non-profit organisation who are not funded, so we rely solely on our fundraising events and donations from the public. Because of the generous support we have been shown from the public and fundraising, we have managed to launch two soup kitchens and rent a 4-bed room in a hostel. The 4-bed room is for our service users who we have been referred on to rehab. There is a waiting list of around three months for referrals into rehab, so we offer a safe place for our service users to stay whilst they await their placement.

By having this mobile catering van this will enable us to reach out to even more vulnerable and homeless people that have found themselves on the streets of Edinburgh. We want to help those who wish to help themselves get off the streets but most importantly give those who want to deal with the cause of why they have become homeless through addiction, abuse, and or mental health a chance. We will deliver hope and build a bridge into a new way of life. We do want to save lives.

PLEASE HELP US TO HELP THOSE TO HELP THEMSELVES
Title: Steps to Hope Catering van

Title: Gatehouse's page

Description:
In times when we have been advised to stay safe by staying at home it becomes evident that housing is one of the main health influences in our lives. Measures such as self isolation, increased hygiene, staying at home, strict social distancing are not a realistic prospect for people experiencing homelessness.

The Nomad Centre, part of the YMCA Lincolnshire, is the only 24/7 direct access night shelter service in Lincolnshire and they provide shelter to over 18s in the form of a bed in a private en-suite room, three meals a day, laundry and a safe supportive environment.  Their incredible service helps residents move forward with their lives to gain access to health care, support services and long-term suitable accommodation.  

Like many charities this year, the YMCA Lincolnshire has seen major fundarising events cancelled and income producing enterprises such as the events centre and café closed which has caused a devastating impact on income.

Fine and Country Lincolnshire and Grantham have worked closely with the YMCA Lincolnshire for over two years and we feel incredibly proud to be sponsoring the food costs for all residents during the 12 Days of Christmas. 

We would love to give more and so we are asking for your help to Give the Gift of Food and Comfort this Christmas to the homeless residents of the Nomad Centre.  It costs £5.50 per day for the centre to provide three meals to one resident and a total daily food cost of £110.  If any individuals or businesses are in the fortunate position at this challenging time of year to be able to help with the gift of food it would be so incredibly kind if you could pledge a meal or more via our Just Giving page and The Fine and Country Foundation will donate 100% of the funds raised to the YMCA Lincolnshire.

We appreciate not everyone is in a position to donate so we are also asking for the gift of comfort.  If you could spare a moment to write some words of comfort and hope to a resident of the Nomad Centre we would be so very grateful.  Please email a message to lincoln@fineandcountry.com or post a message / card to our office Fine and Country, 55 High Street, Navenby, Lincoln, LN5 0DZ and we will ensure every message is printed out and given directly to the residents this Christmas.

Thank you so much for taking the time to visit our Just Giving page.

Once you donate, they'll send your money directly to the charity. So it's the most efficient way to donate - saving time and cutting costs for the charity.

Description:
This year at Rock Kitchen Harris we’re supporting Leicester youth homelessness charity The Y.

Not only does The Y work to help vulnerable young people across the city, but they also operate Leicester’s oldest theatre, giving wide access to the arts and offering many performers their first stage.

This is a really tough time for the charity, so to help them raise funds we’ll be swapping our beds for a night under the stars as we hold a sleep out on Friday 11th September.

We hope to raise a lot of money for The Y, and get an insight into the struggles that young homeless people face.

You can read more about The Y's work at https://www.leicesterymca.co.uk/

All support will be greatly appreciated, whether it's a donation or simply going down to cheer them on! We wish them all the best of luck! Go on girls!

Title: Raising money for the peoples kitchen

Description:
The Killingworth Community Choir have been rehearsing and performing locally for nearly 5 years. When lockdown hit, we decided to meet virtually (thanks to the kind sharing of the St. John's Church zoom account), but for a while we only did quizzes due to the delay issues with zoom. 

Since September we have been singing along on mute while our tireless musical director Selwyn plays the keyboard for us all to sing along. 

We decided to make a recording of Christmas songs as we have missed performing so much. Angela had the clever idea of sharing the recordings on social media along with a Justgiving page to raise the funds that our end of year concert usually generates for charity.

Christine's granddaughter Katy wrote to the committee all the way back in January (before we had heard of lockdown/furlough/COVID etc) to ask that if we raise money this year, please can it be to help people who have become homeless. So this is our way to do this in a socially distanced way.
Title: Killingworth's Killi Carols

Description: We are taking part in the Community Cookathon for Streetyltes to cook 5000 cookies this Valentines Day to raise £5000 for a brilliant charity which feeds and cares for people who are homeless around their base in St Stephens Church in Shepherds Bush. Please sponsor us to replace their broken oven and give over 5000 of West London’s most vulnerable people a weekly hot meal each year. We are lucky enough to have working ovens and we are going to use them to raise these much needed funds at a time of crisis. Each sponsor will receive gift of love heart cookies as a thank you as will the amazing volunteers and the Streetlytes guests. You can’t feed people without an oven! Any money left over once the oven is up and running will go towards giving them a boost in 2021 when their needs are bigger than ever. This is small fundraiser which will make a huge impact. THANK YOU
